onOpen(e) {\n    87â†’  Logger.log(\"onOpen: Starting to create menu\");\n    88â†’  try {\n    89â†’    // Log the authorization mode\n    90â†’    let authModeString = 'Unknown';\n    91â†’    if (e     authModeString = 'AuthMode Unknown value';\n   107â†’      }\n   108â†’    } else {\n   109â†’        authModeString = 'AuthMode property not found on event object (e)';\n   110â†’    }\n   111â†’ 198â†’ */\n   199â†’function checkDocumentStructure() {\n   200â†’  const validation = validateDocumentStructure();\n   201â†’  const ui = DocumentApp.getUi();\n   202â†’\n   203â†’  if ---
[2025-06-23T09:25:07.773Z] Channel: 1386638029690765424
= `Missing tags: ${validation.missingTags.join(\", \")}\\n\\n`;\n   216â†’    }\n   217â†’\n   218â†’    if (validation.bodyCharCount > 0 && validation.bodyCharCount < 500) {\n   219â†’      message += `Body content is too short: ${validation.bodyCharCount} characters (minimum 500 required).\\n\\n`;\n   220â†’    } else if (\n   221â†’      validation.bodyCharCount === 0 &&\n   222â†’      !validation.missingTags.includes(\"body\")\n   223â†’    ) {\n   224â†’      message += \"Body tags exist but content is empty.\\n\\n\";\n   225â†’    }\n   226â†’\n   227â†’    message += \"Please add the missing tags or content to continue.\";\n   228â†’\n   229â†’    ui.alert(\"Document Structure Issues\", message, ui.ButtonSet.OK);\n   230â†’  }\n   231â†’  logAction({\n   232â†’    userEmail: Session.getActiveUser().getEmail(),\n   233â†’    docTitle: DocumentApp.getActiveDocument().getName(),\n   234â†’    docUrl: DocumentApp.getActiveDocument().getUrl(),\n   235â†’    action: 'checkDocumentStructure',\n   236â†’    content: validation.isValid ? 244â†’function showAboutInfo() {\n   245â†’  const ui = DocumentApp.getUi();\n   246â†’\n   247â†’  // Get Apps Script runtime information\n   248â†’  let runtimeInfo = \"\";\n   249â†’  try {\n Asia\",\n   274â†’    ui.ButtonSet.OK,\n   275â†’  );\n   276â†’}\n   277â†’\n   278â†’function showWelcomeScreen() {\n   279â†’  // No need to check auth here anymore, onInstall does it.\n   280â†’ Add-on\");\n   286â†’}\n   287â†’\n   288â†’function checkAuthorization(silent = false) {\n   289â†’  let documentPropsOK = false;\n   290â†’  let urlFetchOK = false;\n   291â†’  Logger.log(`checkAuthorization called (silent=${silent})`); // Log entry\n   292â†’\n   293â†’  try {\n   294â†’    // Test 1: Access Document Properties\n   295â†’    PropertiesService.getDocumentProperties().getKeys();\n   296â†’    documentPropsOK = true;\n   297â†’    Logger.log('checkAuthorization: Document Properties check PASSED'); // Log pass\n   298â†’  } catch (e) {\n   299â†’    Logger.log(`checkAuthorization: Document Properties check FAILED: ${e.message}`); // Log fail\n   300â†’  }\n   301â†’\n   302â†’  try {\n   303â†’    // Test 2: Attempt a harmless external request (Google's own endpoint)\n   304â†’    UrlFetchApp.fetch('https://www.google.com/robots.txt', { muteHttpExceptions: true });\n   305â†’    urlFetchOK = true;\n   306â†’    Logger.log('checkAuthorization: External Request check PASSED'); // Log pass\n   307â†’  } catch (e) {\n   308â†’    Logger.log(`checkAuthorization: External Request check FAILED: ${e.message}`); // Log fail\n   309â†’  }\n   310â†’\n   311â†’  const fullyAuthorized = documentPropsOK && urlFetchOK;\n   312â†’  Logger.log(`checkAuthorization: Final result = ${fullyAuthorized} (DocProps=${documentPropsOK}, UrlFetch=${urlFetchOK})`); // Log combined result\n   313â†’\n   314â†’  if (!fullyAuthorized && !silent) {\n   315â†’    Logger.log('checkAuthorization: Prompting user due to failure (non-silent mode).'); // Log before prompt\n   316â†’    promptAuthorization();\n   317â†’  }\n   318â†’\n   319â†’  return fullyAuthorized;\n   320â†’}\n   321â†’\n   322â†’function promptAuthorization() {\n   323â†’  const ui = DocumentApp.getUi();\n   324â†’  const result = ui.alert(\n   325â†’    \"Authorization Required\",\n   326â†’    \"This add-on needs your permission to function. Would you like to authorize now?\",\n   327â†’    ui.ButtonSet.YES_NO\n   328â†’  );\n   329â†’\n   330â†’  if (result === ui.Button.YES) {\n   331â†’    authorizeApp();\n   332â†’  }\n   333â†’}\n   334â†’\n   335â†’// Get properties when needed, not globally\n   336â†’function getProperties() {\n   337â†’  return PropertiesService.getDocumentProperties();\n   338â†’}\n   339â†’\n   340â†’function authorizeApp() {\n   341â†’  Logger.log(\"authorizeApp: Attempting to trigger authorization flow...\");\n   342â†’  // Perform the actions directly. If authorization is missing for either,\n   343â†’  // Google should interrupt the execution and show the standard prompt.\n   344â†’  PropertiesService.getDocumentProperties().getKeys(); // Check doc access first\n   345â†’  // If the above succeeds but URL fetch is missing, this should trigger it:\n   346â†’  UrlFetchApp.fetch('https://www.google.com/robots.txt', { muteHttpExceptions: true });\n   347â†’  // If the script reaches here, it means *both* permissions were likely already present,\n   348â†’  // which is unexpected if this function was called due to AUTH_ERROR, but harmless.\n   349â†’  Logger.log(\"authorizeApp: Trigger actions completed (or were already permitted).\");\n   350â†’}\n   351â†’\n   352â†’function getLoggingDestination() {\n   353â†’  return LOGGING_DESTINATION;\n   354â†’}\n   355â†’\n   356â†’/**\n   357â†’ * Shows information about the current environment\n   358â†’ */\n   359â†’function showEnvironmentInfo() {\n   360â†’  const ui = DocumentApp.getUi();\n   361â†’\n   362â†’  // Check if credentials exist\n   363â†’  const scriptProps = PropertiesService.getScriptProperties();\n   364â†’  let credentialStatus = '';\n   365â†’\n   366â†’  if (ENVIRONMENT === 'dev') {\n   367â†’    const hasDevCreds = scriptProps.getProperty('AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID') && scriptProps.getProperty('AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY');\n   368â†’    credentialStatus = hasDevCreds ? 'âœ… Dev credentials found' : 'âŒ Dev credentials missing';\n   369â†’  } else {\n   370â†’    const hasEnvCreds = scriptProps.getProperty(`TIA_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`) && scriptProps.getProperty(`TIA_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`);\n   371â†’    credentialStatus = hasEnvCreds ? `âœ… ${ENVIRONMENT.toUpperCase()} credentials found` : `âŒ ${ENVIRONMENT.toUpperCase()} credentials missing`;\n   372â†’  }\n   373â†’\n   374â†’  // For staging, also check WordPress connection\n   375â†’  let wpStatus = '';\n   376â†’  if (ENVIRONMENT === 'stg') {\n   377â†’    const wpTest = testWordPressConnection();\n   378â†’    wpStatus = `\\nWordPress Connection: ${wpTest.success ? logging configuration\n   400â†’ */\n   401â†’function testAWSLogging() {\n   402â†’  const { userEmail, docTitle, docUrl } = getDocumentAndUserInfo();\n   403â†’  const ui = DocumentApp.getUi();\n reloads the page\n   465â†’ * @param {string} environment - The environment to set ('dev', 'stg', or 'prod')\n   466â†’ */\n   467â†’function setEnvironment(environment) {\n   468â†’  if (['dev', 'stg', 'prod'].includes(environment)) {\n   469â†’    PropertiesService.getScriptProperties().setProperty('ENVIRONMENT', environment);\n   470â†’\n   471â†’    const ui = DocumentApp.getUi();\n   472â†’    ui.alert(\n   473â†’      \"Environment Changed\",\n   474â†’      `Environment has been set to: ${environment}\\n\\n` +\n   475â†’      \"You need to refresh the page for changes to take effect.\",\n   476â†’      ui.ButtonSet.OK\n   477â†’    );\n   478â†’  }\n   479â†’  return \"Environment updated\";\n   480â†’}\n   481â†’\n   482â†’// Modify the host selection logic in the WordPress publishing function\n   483â†’function getWordPressHost() {\n   484â†’  switch(ENVIRONMENT) {\n   485â†’    case 'dev':\n   486â†’      return 'dev.techinasia.com';\n   487â†’    case 'stg':\n   488â†’      return STG_TUNNEL_URL; // Using ngrok tunnel to stg.techinasia.com\n   489â†’    case 'prod':\n   490â†’      return 'www.techinasia.com';\n   491â†’    default:\n   492â†’      return 'stg.techinasia.com';\n   493â†’  }\n   494â†’}\n   495â†’\n   496â†’// Add this after getWordPressHost function\n   497â†’function testWordPressConnection() {\n   498â†’  // Allow testing in both staging and production environments\n   499â†’  if (ENVIRONMENT !== 'stg' && ENVIRONMENT !== 'prod') {\n   500â†’    return { error: 'Connection test only available in staging and production environments' };\n   501â†’  }\n   502â†’\n   503â†’  const host = getWordPressHost();\n   504â†’  const logs = [`Testing connection to WordPress: ${host}`];\n   505â†’\n   506â†’  try {\n   507â†’    // Get signature from script properties\n   508â†’    let signature = null;\n   509â†’    if (ENVIRONMENT === 'prod') {\n   510â†’      signature = PropertiesService.getScriptProperties().getProperty('PROD_WP_SIGNATURE');\n   511â†’    } else {\n   512â†’      signature = PropertiesService.getScriptProperties().getProperty('WP_SIGNATURE');\n   513â†’    }\n   514â†’\n   515â†’    if (!signature) {\n   516â†’      logs.push(\"No signature found in script properties\");\n   517â†’      return {\n   518â†’        success: false,\n   519â†’        error: \"Missing required signature\",\n   520â†’        logs\n   521â†’      };\n   522â†’    }\n   523â†’\n   524â†’    // Use the editorial webhook endpoint with signature parameter\n   525â†’    const endpoint = `https://${host}/wp-json/techinasia/3.0/admin/editorial/webhook/posts?signature=${signature}`;\n   526â†’    logs.push(`Testing endpoint: ${endpoint}`);\n   527â†’\n   528â†’    const options = {\n   529â†’      'method': 'post',\n   530â†’      'muteHttpExceptions': true,\n   531â†’      'validateHttpsCertificates': ENVIRONMENT === 'prod',\n   532â†’      'headers': {\n   533â†’        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n   534â†’      },\n   535â†’      'payload': JSON.stringify({})\n   536â†’    };\n   537â†’\n   538â†’    // Add token if available (only for staging)\n   539â†’    if (ENVIRONMENT !== 'prod') {\n   540â†’      const token = PropertiesService.getScriptProperties().getProperty('WP_TOKEN');\n   541â†’      if (token) {\n   542â†’        options.headers['Authorization'] = `Bearer ${token}`;\n   543â†’        logs.push(\"Added authorization token to request\");\n   544â†’      } else {\n   545â†’        logs.push(\"Warning: No authorization token found\");\n   546â†’      }\n   547â†’    } else {\n   548â†’      logs.push(\"Production environment: Not using bearer token as requested\");\n   549â†’    }\n   550â†’\n   551â†’    logs.push('Sending POST request...');\n   552â†’    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(endpoint, options);\n   553â†’    const responseCode = response.getResponseCode();\n   554â†’    const responseText = response.getContentText();\n   555â†’\n   556â†’    logs.push(`Response code: ${responseCode}`);\n   557â†’    logs.push(`Response text: ${responseText}`);\n   558â†’\n   559â†’    // Parse response if it's JSON\n   560â†’    let parsedResponse = null;\n   561â†’    try {\n   562â†’      parsedResponse = JSON.parse(responseText);\n   563â†’    } catch (e) {\n   564â†’      logs.push(\"Response is not valid JSON\");\n   565â†’    }\n   566â†’\n   567â†’    // Consider 2xx responses as successful\n   568â†’    // Also consider 500 with \"empty_content\" as successful for connection testing\n   569â†’    // since it means we've reached the API and authenticated successfully\n   570â†’    const isSuccessful = responseCode >= 200 && responseCode < 300 ||\n   571â†’      responseText,\n   577â†’      host,\n   578â†’      logs\n   579â†’    };\n   580â†’  } catch (error) {\n   581â†’    logs.push(`Error: ${error.toString()}`);\n   582â†’    return {\n   583â†’      success: false,\n   584â†’      error: error.toString(),\n   585â†’      host,\n   586â†’      logs\n   587â†’    };\n   588â†’  }\n   589â†’}\n   590â†’\n   591â†’// Update show test results \"normal\"\n   192â†’    },\n   193â†’    \"growth_keywords\": {\n   194â†’        \"keywords\": [\"growth\", \"increase\", \"surge\", \"rising\", \"expanding\", \"scaling\"],\n   195â†’        \"effects\": {\n   196â†’            \"portrait\": \"pan_up\",\n   197â†’            \"landscape\": \"zoom_and_pan_up\",\n   198â†’            \"square\": \"pan_up\"\n   199â†’        },\n   200â†’        \"default_intensity\": \"normal\"\n   201â†’    }\n   202â†’}\n   203â†’\n   204â†’def analyze_image(image_path: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n   205â†’    \"\"\"\n   206â†’    Analyze image characteristics for optimal Ken Burns effect selection\n   207â†’\n   208â†’    Args:\n   209â†’        image_path: Path to the image file\n   210â†’\n   211â†’    Returns:\n   212â†’        Dict with image analysis results including ken_burns_suitable flag\n   213â†’    \"\"\"\n   214â†’    try:\n   215â†’        with Image.open(image_path) as img:\n   216â†’            width, height = img.size\n   217â†’            aspect_ratio = width / height\n   218â†’\n   219â†’            # Classify aspect ratio\n   220â†’            if aspect_ratio > 1.3:\n   221â†’                aspect_type = \"landscape\"\n   222â†’            elif aspect_ratio < 0.77:\n   223â†’                aspect_type = \"portrait\"\n   224â†’            else:\n   225â†’                aspect_type = \"square\"\n   226â†’\n   227â†’            # Calculate minimum resolution for quality Ken Burns effects\n   228â†’            min_dimension = min(width, height)\n   229â†’            max_dimension = max(width, height)\n   230â†’\n   231â†’            # Ken Burns suitability criteria\n   232â†’            # For 9:16 output (1080x1920), we need enough resolution to crop and zoom\n   233â†’            ken_burns_suitable = True\n   234â†’            unsuitability_reasons = []\n   235â†’\n   236â†’            # Minimum resolution check (lowered threshold for more compatibility)\n   237â†’            if min_dimension < 500:\n   238â†’                ken_burns_suitable = False\n   239â†’                unsuitability_reasons.append(f\"too_small_resolution_{min_dimension}px\")\n   240â†’\n   241â†’            # Aspect ratio vs target compatibility\n   242â†’            target_aspect = 1080/1920  # 0.5625 (9:16)\n   243â†’            aspect_diff = abs(aspect_ratio - target_aspect)\n   244â†’\n   245â†’            # If image aspect is very different from target, Ken Burns may not work well\n   246â†’            if aspect_diff > 1.5:  # Very different aspect ratios\n   247â†’                ken_burns_suitable = False\n   248â†’                unsuitability_reasons.append(f\"aspect_mismatch_{aspect_ratio:.2f}\")\n   249â†’\n   250â†’            # For very wide landscape images (like panoramas)\n   251â†’            if aspect_ratio > 3.0:\n   252â†’                ken_burns_suitable = False\n   253â†’                unsuitability_reasons.append(f\"too_wide_panorama_{aspect_ratio:.2f}\")\n   254â†’\n   255â†’            # For very tall portrait images\n   256â†’            if aspect_ratio < 0.3:\n   257â†’                ken_burns_suitable = False\n   258â†’                unsuitability_reasons.append(f\"too_tall_portrait_{aspect_ratio:.2f}\")\n   259â†’\n   260â†’            # Calculate effective zoom range for Ken Burns effects\n   261â†’            # For Ken Burns, we consider how the image will be processed (scale then crop/pan)\n   262â†’\n   263â†’            # For landscape images: scale to height, then crop width -> plenty of room for pan/zoom\n   264â†’            if aspect_type == \"landscape\":\n   265â†’                # Scale to target height: new_width = width * (1920/height)\n   266â†’                scaled_width = width * (1920 / height)\n   267â†’                pan_room = scaled_width / 1080  # How much extra width for panning\n   268â†’                max_safe_zoom = min(pan_room * 0.7, 2.0)  # Conservative factor for smooth motion\n   269â†’                max_safe_zoom = max(max_safe_zoom, 1.2)   # Always allow reasonable zoom for landscapes\n   270â†’\n   271â†’            # For portrait images: scale to width, then crop/pad height\n   272â†’            elif aspect_type == \"portrait\":\n   273â†’                # Scale to target width: new_height = height * (1080/width)\n   274â†’                scaled_height = height * (1080 / width)\n   275â†’                pan_room = scaled_height / 1920  # How much extra height for panning\n   276â†’                max_safe_zoom = min(pan_room * 0.7, 2.0)\n   277â†’                max_safe_zoom = max(max_safe_zoom, 1.2)   # Always allow reasonable zoom for portraits\n   278â†’\n   279â†’            # For square images: flexible scaling\n   280â†’            else:\n   281â†’                scale_factor = max(width / 1080, height / 1920)\n   282â†’                max_safe_zoom = min(scale_factor * 0.7, 2.0)\n   283â†’                max_safe_zoom = max(max_safe_zoom, 1.15)\n   284â†’\n   285â†’            # Only reject if the image is genuinely too small for any Ken Burns effect\n   286â†’            min_effective_zoom = 1.1\n   287â†’            if max_safe_zoom < min_effective_zoom:\n   288â†’                ken_burns_suitable = False\n   289â†’                unsuitability_reasons.append(f\"insufficient_zoom_range_{max_safe_zoom:.2f}\")\n   290â†’\n   291â†’            resolution_category = \"high\" if min_dimension > 1500 else \"medium\" if min_dimension > 800 else \"low\"\n   292â†’\n   293â†’            return {\n   294â†’                \"width\": width,\n   295â†’                \"height\": height,\n   296â†’                \"aspect_ratio\": aspect_ratio,\n   297â†’                \"aspect_type\": aspect_type,\n   298â†’                \"max_safe_zoom\": max_safe_zoom,\n   299â†’                \"resolution_category\": resolution_category,\n   300â†’                \"ken_burns_suitable\": ken_burns_suitable,\n   301â†’                \"unsuitability_reasons\": unsuitability_reasons,\n   302â†’                \"min_dimension\": min_dimension,\n   303â†’                \"max_dimension\": max_dimension\n   304â†’            }\n   305â†’\n   306â†’    except Exception as e:\n   307â†’        logger.error(f\"Error analyzing image {image_path}: {e}\")\n   308â†’        return {\n   309â†’            \"width\": 1080,\n   310â†’            \"height\": 1920,\n   311â†’            \"aspect_ratio\": 0.56,\n   312â†’            \"aspect_type\": \"portrait\",\n   313â†’            \"max_safe_zoom\": 1.2,\n   314â†’            \"resolution_category\": \"medium\",\n   315â†’            \"ken_burns_suitable\": False,\n   316â†’            \"unsuitability_reasons\": [\"analysis_error\"],\n   317â†’            \"min_dimension\": 1080,\n   318â†’            \"max_dimension\": 1920\n   319â†’        }\n   320â†’\n   321â†’def get_zoom_position_coordinates(position: str) -> Dict[str, str]:\n   322â†’    \"\"\"\n   323â†’    Get FFmpeg zoom position coordinates based on position name\n   324â†’\n   325â†’    Args:\n   326â†’        position: Position name (center, top, bottom, left, right, top_left, etc.)\n   327â†’\n   328â†’    Returns:\n   329â†’        Dict with x and y coordinate expressions for FFmpeg\n   330â†’    \"\"\"\n   331â†’    positions = {\n   332â†’        \"center\": {\n   333â†’            \"x\": \"iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)\",\n   334â†’            \"y\": \"ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)\"\n   335â†’        },\n   336â†’        \"top\": {\n   337â†’            \"x\": \"iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)\",\n   338â†’            \"y\": \"0\"\n   339â†’        },\n   340â†’        \"bottom\": {\n   341â†’            \"x\": \"iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)\",\n   342â†’            \"y\": \"ih-ih/zoom\"\n   343â†’        },\n   344â†’        \"left\": {\n   345â†’            \"x\": \"0\",\n   346â†’            \"y\": \"ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)\"\n   347â†’        },\n   348â†’        \"right\": {\n   349â†’            \"x\": \"iw-iw/zoom\",\n   350â†’            \"y\": \"ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)\"\n   351â†’        },\n   352â†’        \"top_left\": {\n   353â†’            \"x\": \"0\",\n   354â†’            \"y\": \"0\"\n   355â†’        },\n   356â†’        \"top_right\": {\n   357â†’            \"x\": \"iw-iw/zoom\",\n   358â†’            \"y\": \"0\"\n   359â†’        },\n   360â†’        \"bottom_left\": {\n   361â†’            \"x\": \"0\",\n   362â†’            \"y\": \"ih-ih/zoom\"\n   363â†’        },\n   364â†’        \"bottom_right\": {\n   365â†’            \"x\": \"iw-iw/zoom\",\n   366â†’            \"y\": \"ih-ih/zoom\"\n   367â†’        }\n   368â†’    }\n   369â†’\n   370â†’    return positions.get(position, positions[\"center\"])\n   371â†’\n   372â†’def detect_content_context(text_content: str) -> Optional[str]:\n   373â†’    \"\"\"\n   374â†’    Detect content context from text for effect selection\n   375â†’\n   376â†’    Args:\n   377â†’        text_content: Text content to analyze\n   378â†’\n   379â†’    Returns:\n   380â†’        Context key or None if no match found\n   381â†’    \"\"\"\n   382â†’    if not text_content:\n   383â†’        return None\n   384â†’\n   385â†’    text_lower = text_content.lower()\n   386â†’\n   387â†’    for context_key, mapping in CONTENT_EFFECT_MAPPING.items():\n   388â†’        keywords = mapping[\"keywords\"]\n   389â†’        if any(keyword.lower() in text_lower for keyword in keywords):\n   390â†’            logger.debug(f\"Detected content context '{context_key}' for text: '{text_content[:50]}...'\")\n   391â†’            return context_key\n   392â†’\n   393â†’    return None\n   394â†’\n   395â†’def select_optimal_effect(\n   396â†’    image_analysis: Dict[str, Any],\n   397â†’    text_content: str = \"\",\n   398â†’    custom_effect: Optional[str] = None\n   399â†’) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n   400â†’    \"\"\"\n   401â†’    Select optimal Ken Burns effect based on image and content analysis\n   402â†’\n   403â†’    Args:\n   404â†’        image_analysis: Results from analyze_image()\n   405â†’        text_content: Scene text content for context detection\n   406â†’        custom_effect: Override with specific effect type\n   407â†’\n   408â†’    Returns:\n   409â†’        Optimal Ken Burns effect configuration\n   410â†’    \"\"\"\n   411â†’    aspect_type = image_analysis[\"aspect_type\"]\n   412â†’\n   413â†’    # Use custom effect if specified\n   414â†’    if custom_effect and custom_effect in KEN_BURNS_EFFECTS:\n   415â†’        return {\n   416â†’            \"type\": custom_effect,\n   417â†’            \"intensity\": \"normal\",\n   418â†’            \"reason\": \"custom_specified\"\n   419â†’        }\n   420â†’\n   421â†’    # Detect content context\n   422â†’    context = detect_content_context(text_content)\n   423â†’\n   424â†’    if context and context in CONTENT_EFFECT_MAPPING:\n   425â†’        mapping = CONTENT_EFFECT_MAPPING[context]\n   426â†’        effect_type = mapping[\"effects\"].get(aspect_type, mapping[\"effects\"][\"square\"])\n   427â†’        intensity = mapping[\"default_intensity\"]\n   428â†’\n   429â†’        return {\n   430â†’            \"type\": effect_type,\n   431â†’            \"intensity\": intensity,\n   432â†’            \"reason\": f\"content_context_{context}\"\n   433â†’        }\n   434â†’\n   435â†’    # Fallback based on aspect ratio only\n   436â†’    fallback_effects = {\n   437â†’        \"portrait\": \"zoom_in\",\n   438â†’        \"landscape\": \"pan_right_zoom\",\n   439â†’        \"square\": \"zoom_in\"\n   440â†’    }\n   441â†’\n   442â†’    return {\n   443â†’        \"type\": fallback_effects[aspect_type],\n   444â†’        \"intensity\": \"normal\",\n   445â†’        \"reason\": \"aspect_ratio_fallback\"\n   446â†’    }\n   447â†’\n   448â†’def generate_ffmpeg_command(\n   449â†’    input_path: str,\n   450â†’    output_path: str,\n   451â†’    effect_config: Dict[str, Any],\n   452â†’    image_analysis: Dict[str, Any],\n   453â†’    duration: float,\n   454â†’    ken_burns_config: Dict[str, Any] = None\n   455â†’) -> list:\n   456â†’    \"\"\"\n   457â†’    Generate FFmpeg command for Ken Burns effect\n   458â†’\n   459â†’    Args:\n   460â†’        input_path: Path to input image\n   461â†’        output_path: Path for output video\n   462â†’        effect_config: Effect configuration from select_optimal_effect()\n   463â†’        image_analysis: Image analysis results\n   464â†’        duration: Video duration in seconds\n   465â†’        ken_burns_config: Original Ken Burns configuration with overrides\n   466â†’\n   467â†’    Returns:\n   468â†’        FFmpeg command as list of strings\n   469â†’    \"\"\"\n   470â†’    effect_type = effect_config[\"type\"]\n   471â†’    intensity = effect_config[\"intensity\"]\n   472â†’    aspect_type = image_analysis[\"aspect_type\"]\n   473â†’    max_safe_zoom = image_analysis[\"max_safe_zoom\"]\n   474â†’\n   475â†’    # Get effect parameters\n   476â†’    if effect_type not in KEN_BURNS_EFFECTS:\n   477â†’        logger.warning(f\"Unknown effect type {effect_type}, using zoom_in\")\n   478â†’        effect_type = \"zoom_in\"\n   479â†’\n   480â†’    effect_params = KEN_BURNS_EFFECTS[effect_type][\"intensities\"][intensity].copy()\n   481â†’\n   482â†’    # Apply configurable overrides from ken_burns_config\n   483â†’    if ken_burns_config:\n   484â†’        # Override zoom amount if specified\n   485â†’        zoom_amount = ken_burns_config.get(\"zoom_amount\")\n   486â†’        if zoom_amount and isinstance(zoom_amount, (int, float)):\n   487â†’            zoom_amount = max(1.1, min(2.0, float(zoom_amount)))  # Clamp to safe range\n   488â†’            zoom_amount = min(zoom_amount, max_safe_zoom)  # Respect image limits\n   489â†’\n   490â†’            # Update zoom-related parameters based on effect type\n   491â†’            if \"zoom_increment\" in effect_params:\n   492â†’                # For progressive zoom effects (zoom_in, zoom_and_pan_up)\n   493â†’                base_zoom = 1.0\n   494â†’                total_zoom_change = zoom_amount - base_zoom\n   495â†’                effect_params[\"zoom_increment\"] = total_zoom_change / (duration * 30)  # Per frame\n   496â†’                logger.info(f\"Override zoom_increment to {effect_params['zoom_increment']:.4f} for target zoom {zoom_amount}\")\n   497â†’\n   498â†’            if \"max_zoom\" in effect_params:\n   499â†’                effect_params[\"max_zoom\"] = zoom_amount\n   500â†’                logger.info(f\"Override max_zoom to {zoom_amount}\")\n   501â†’\n   502â†’            if \"zoom_start\" in effect_params:\n   503â†’                effect_params[\"zoom_start\"] = zoom_amount\n   504â†’                logger.info(f\"Override zoom_start to {zoom_amount}\")\n   505â†’\n   506â†’            # For zoom_out, zoom_amount should set the starting zoom level\n   507â†’            if effect_type == \"zoom_out\":\n   508â†’                effect_params[\"zoom_start\"] = zoom_amount\n   509â†’                logger.info(f\"Override zoom_out start zoom to {zoom_amount}\")\n   510â†’\n   511â†’            if \"zoom_factor\" in effect_params:\n   512â†’                effect_params[\"zoom_factor\"] = zoom_amount\n   513â†’                logger.info(f\"Override zoom_factor to {zoom_amount}\")\n   514â†’\n   515â†’        # Override pan speed if specified\n   516â†’        pan_speed = ken_burns_config.get(\"pan_speed\")\n   517â†’        if pan_speed and isinstance(pan_speed, (int, float)):\n   518â†’            pan_speed = max(0.5, min(2.0, float(pan_speed)))  # Clamp to reasonable range\n   519â†’\n   520â†’            # Adjust duration factor to affect pan speed\n   521â†’            original_duration_factor = effect_params.get(\"duration_factor\", 1.0)\n   522â†’            # Slower pan = longer duration, faster pan = shorter duration\n   523â†’            effect_params[\"duration_factor\"] = original_duration_factor / pan_speed\n   524â†’            logger.info(f\"Override pan speed to {pan_speed}x (duration_factor: {effect_params['duration_factor']:.2f})\")\n   525â†’\n   526â†’    # Adjust duration based on effect and overrides\n   527â†’    adjusted_duration = duration * effect_params.get(\"duration_factor\", 1.0)\n   528â†’    frames = int(adjusted_duration * 30)  # 30 fps for smoother motion\n   529â†’\n   530â†’    # Base command\n   531â†’    cmd = [\n   532â†’        \"ffmpeg\", \"-y\", \"-loop\", \"1\", \"-i\", input_path\n   533â†’    ]\n   534â†’\n   535â†’    # Generate filter based on effect type and aspect ratio\n   536â†’    if effect_type.startswith(\"zoom_in\"):\n   537â†’        zoom_increment = min(effect_params[\"zoom_increment\"], 0.002)  # Safety limit\n   538â†’        max_zoom = min(effect_params.get(\"max_zoom\", 1.3), max_safe_zoom)\n   539â†’\n   540â†’        # Get zoom position coordinates\n   541â†’        position = effect_params.get(\"position\", \"center\")\n   542â†’        coords = get_zoom_position_coordinates(position)\n   543â†’        zoom_x = coords[\"x\"]\n   544â†’        zoom_y = coords[\"y\"]\n   545â†’\n   546â†’        if aspect_type == \"portrait\":\n   547â†’            # Portrait: positioned zoom based on coordinates - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   548â†’            filter_complex = (\n   549â†’                f\"scale=1080:1920:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease,\"\n   550â†’                f\"pad=1080:1920:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2:black,\"\n   551â†’                f\"zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+{zoom_increment},{max_zoom})':x='{zoom_x}':y='{zoom_y}'\"\n   552â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   553â†’            )\n   554â†’        elif aspect_type == \"landscape\":\n   555â†’            # Landscape: scale to fit height then crop width, with positioned zoom - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   556â†’            filter_complex = (\n   557â†’                f\"scale=-1:1920,\"\n   558â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:(iw-1080)/2:0,\"\n   559â†’                f\"zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+{zoom_increment},{max_zoom})':x='{zoom_x}':y='{zoom_y}'\"\n   560â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   561â†’            )\n   562â†’        else:  # square\n   563â†’            # Square: flexible positioning with coordinates - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   564â†’            filter_complex = (\n   565â†’                f\"scale=1440:1440,\"\n   566â†’                f\"zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+{zoom_increment},{max_zoom})':x='{zoom_x}':y='{zoom_y}'\"\n   567â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   568â†’            )\n   569â†’\n   570â†’    elif effect_type == \"zoom_out\":\n   571â†’        zoom_start = min(effect_params.get(\"zoom_start\", 1.4), max_safe_zoom)\n   572â†’        zoom_end = effect_params.get(\"zoom_end\", 0.85)  # Use explicit end zoom for true reveal\n   573â†’\n   574â†’        if aspect_type == \"portrait\":\n   575â†’            # Portrait: start zoomed in, smoothly zoom out - REVERTED: zoom_out should be self-contained\n   576â†’            filter_complex = (\n   577â†’                f\"scale=1080:1920:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease,\"\n   578â†’                f\"pad=1080:1920:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2:black,\"\n   579â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_start}-(on/{frames})*({zoom_start}-{zoom_end})'\"  # Original working zoom out\n   580â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'\"\n   581â†’                f\":d={frames}:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   582â†’            )\n   583â†’        elif aspect_type == \"landscape\":\n   584â†’            # Landscape: start zoomed in, smoothly zoom out - REVERTED: zoom_out should be self-contained\n   585â†’            filter_complex = (\n   586â†’                f\"scale=-1:1920,\"\n   587â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:(iw-1080)/2:0,\"\n   588â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_start}-(on/{frames})*({zoom_start}-{zoom_end})'\"  # Original working zoom out\n   589â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'\"\n   590â†’                f\":d={frames}:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   591â†’            )\n   592â†’        else:  # square\n   593â†’            # Square: start zoomed in, smoothly zoom out - REVERTED: zoom_out should be self-contained\n   594â†’            filter_complex = (\n   595â†’                f\"scale=1440:1440,\"\n   596â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_start}-(on/{frames})*({zoom_start}-{zoom_end})'\"  # Original working zoom out\n   597â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'\"\n   598â†’                f\":d={frames}:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   599â†’            )\n   600â†’\n   601â†’    elif effect_type == \"pan_up\":\n   602â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   603â†’        zoom_factor = min(effect_params[\"zoom_factor\"], max_safe_zoom)\n   604â†’\n   605â†’        if aspect_type == \"landscape\":\n   606â†’            # Landscape â†’ TikTok vertical: Scale to HEIGHT first, then crop width - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   607â†’            filter_complex = (\n   608â†’                f\"scale=-2:1920,setsar=1:1,\"  # Scale to target HEIGHT, maintain aspect (creates extra width)\n   609â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:(iw-ow)/2:0,\"  # Crop excess width, keep full height\n   610â†’                f\"scale=8000:-1,\"  # Upscale for smooth zoompan movement\n   611â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_factor}'\"\n   612â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)'\"  # Center horizontally\n   613â†’                f\":y='max(py+(ih-ih/zoom)/{frames},0)'\"  # Pan from bottom to top (continuous from previous)\n   614â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   615â†’            )\n   616â†’        else:\n   617â†’            # Portrait/Square â†’ TikTok vertical: Use same approach as landscape for immediate pan - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   618â†’            # Scale to WIDTH first, then crop height, then upscale for smooth panning\n   619â†’            filter_complex = (\n   620â†’                f\"scale=1080:-2,setsar=1:1,\"  # Scale to target WIDTH, maintain aspect (creates extra height)\n   621â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:0:(ih-oh)/2,\"  # Crop excess height, keep full width\n   622â†’                f\"scale=-1:8000,\"  # Upscale for smooth zoompan movement\n   623â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_factor}'\"\n   624â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)'\"  # Center horizontally\n   625â†’                f\":y='max(py+(ih-ih/zoom)/{frames},0)'\"  # Pan from bottom to top (continuous from previous)\n   626â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   627â†’            )\n   628â†’\n   629â†’    elif effect_type == \"pan_down\":\n   630â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   631â†’        zoom_factor = min(effect_params[\"zoom_factor\"], max_safe_zoom)\n   632â†’\n   633â†’        if aspect_type == \"landscape\":\n   634â†’            # Landscape â†’ TikTok vertical: Pan down from top to bottom - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   635â†’            filter_complex = (\n   636â†’                f\"scale=-2:1920,setsar=1:1,\"  # Scale to target HEIGHT, maintain aspect\n   637â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:(iw-ow)/2:0,\"  # Crop excess width\n   638â†’                f\"scale=8000:-1,\"  # Upscale for smooth movement\n   639â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_factor}'\"\n   640â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)'\"  # Center horizontally\n   641â†’                f\":y='min(py+(ih-ih/zoom)/{frames},(ih-ih/zoom))'\"  # Pan from top to bottom (continuous from previous)\n   642â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   643â†’            )\n   644â†’        else:\n   645â†’            # Portrait/Square â†’ TikTok vertical: Pan down from top to bottom - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   646â†’            filter_complex = (\n   647â†’                f\"scale=1080:-2,setsar=1:1,\"  # Scale to target WIDTH, maintain aspect\n   648â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:0:(ih-oh)/2,\"  # Crop excess height\n   649â†’                f\"scale=-1:8000,\"  # Upscale for smooth movement\n   650â†’                f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_factor}'\"\n   651â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)'\"  # Center horizontally\n   652â†’                f\":y='min(py+(ih-ih/zoom)/{frames},(ih-ih/zoom))'\"  # Pan from top to bottom (continuous from previous)\n   653â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   654â†’            )\n   655â†’\n   656â†’    elif effect_type == \"pan_right_zoom\":\n   657â†’        # Ideal for landscape images - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   658â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   659â†’        zoom_increment = effect_params[\"zoom_increment\"]\n   660â†’\n   661â†’        filter_complex = (\n   662â†’            f\"scale=1920:1920:force_original_aspect_ratio=increase,\"\n   663â†’            f\"crop=1440:1920:(iw-ow)/2:(ih-oh)/2,\"\n   664â†’ f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   667â†’        )\n   668â†’\n   669â†’    elif effect_type == \"pan_left_zoom\":\n   670â†’        # Pan left with zoom - ideal for landscape images - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   671â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   672â†’        zoom_increment = effect_params[\"zoom_increment\"]\n   673â†’\n   674â†’        filter_complex = (\n   675â†’            f\"scale=1920:1920:force_original_aspect_ratio=increase,\"\n   676â†’            f\"crop=1440:1920:(iw-ow)/2:(ih-oh)/2,\"\n   677â†’            f\"zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+{zoom_increment},2.0)'\"\n   678â†’            f\":x='max(px-(iw-ow)*{pan_range}*on/{frames},0)':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'\"\n   679â†’            f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   680â†’        )\n   681â†’\n   682â†’    elif effect_type == \"pan_left\":\n   683â†’        # Simple pan left without zoom - ideal for landscape images\n   684â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   685â†’        zoom_factor = effect_params[\"zoom_factor\"]  # Should be 1.0 for no zoom\n   686â†’\n   687â†’        filter_complex = (\n   688â†’            f\"scale=1920:1920:force_original_aspect_ratio=increase,\"\n   689â†’            f\"crop=1440:1920:(iw-ow)/2:(ih-oh)/2,\"\n   690â†’            f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_factor}'\"  # No zoom, constant 1.0\n   691â†’            f\":x='(iw-ow)*max(1-{pan_range}*on/{frames},1-{pan_range})':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'\"\n   692â†’            f\":d={frames}:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   693â†’        )\n   694â†’\n   695â†’    elif effect_type == \"pan_right\":\n   696â†’        # Simple pan right without zoom - ideal for landscape images\n   697â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   698â†’        zoom_factor = effect_params[\"zoom_factor\"]  # Should be 1.0 for no zoom\n   699â†’\n   700â†’        filter_complex = (\n   701â†’            f\"scale=1920:1920:force_original_aspect_ratio=increase,\"\n   702â†’            f\"crop=1440:1920:(iw-ow)/2:(ih-oh)/2,\"\n   703â†’            f\"zoompan=z='{zoom_factor}'\"  # No zoom, constant 1.0\n   704â†’            f\":x='(iw-ow)*min({pan_range}*on/{frames},{pan_range})':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'\"\n   705â†’            f\":d={frames}:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   706â†’        )\n   707â†’\n   708â†’    elif effect_type == \"zoom_and_pan_up\":\n   709â†’        zoom_increment = effect_params[\"zoom_increment\"]\n   710â†’        pan_range = effect_params[\"pan_range\"]\n   711â†’        base_zoom = 1.0  # Start at normal zoom level for zoom+pan effects\n   712â†’\n   713â†’        if aspect_type == \"landscape\":\n   714â†’            # Landscape â†’ TikTok vertical: WORKING movement + correct aspect ratio - FIXED: maintain continuity\n   715â†’            # Use the movement logic that worked in PERFECT version but with correct transformations\n   716â†’            filter_complex = (\n   717â†’                f\"scale=-2:1920,setsar=1:1,\"  # Scale to target HEIGHT, maintain aspect (creates extra width)\n   718â†’                f\"crop=1080:1920:(iw-ow)/2:0,\"  # Crop excess width, keep full height\n   719â†’                f\"scale=8000:-1,\"  # Upscale for smooth zoompan movement\n   720â†’                f\"zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+{zoom_increment},2.0)'\"  # Progressive zoom with continuity\n   721â†’                f\":x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)'\"  # Center horizontally\n   722â†’                f\":y='max(py+(ih-oh)/{frames},0)'\"  # Pan from bottom to top (continuous from previous)\n   723â†’                f\":d=1:s=1080x1920:fps=30\"\n   724â†’            )\n   725â†’        else:\n   726â†’            # Portrait/Square â†’ TikTok vertical: Use same {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01NxhiXAhuDYmCAcDpUnPR86","type":"tool_result","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Based on my search through the codebase, here's a comprehensive overview of the Ken Burns effects implementation:\n\n## Ken Burns Effects Implementation\n\n### Main Implementation File\n**`/Users/erniesg/code/erniesg/wanx/backend/text_to_video/fx/ken_burns_ffmpeg.py`**\n\nThis is the core module that implements Ken Burns effects using FFmpeg. Key components:\n\n1. **Effect Library** (`KEN_BURNS_EFFECTS` dictionary):\n   - **Zoom effects**: `zoom_in`, `zoom_in_top`, `zoom_in_bottom`, `zoom_in_left`, `zoom_in_right`, `zoom_in_top_left`, `zoom_in_top_right`, `zoom_in_bottom_left`, `zoom_in_bottom_right`, `zoom_out`\n   - **Pan effects**: `pan_up`, `pan_down`, `pan_left`, `pan_right`\n   - **Combined effects**: `zoom_and_pan_up`, `pan_right_zoom`, `pan_left_zoom`\n   \n   Each effect supports three intensity levels: `subtle`, `normal`, `dramatic`\n\n2. **Key Functions**:\n   - `analyze_image()`: Analyzes image dimensions and determines if it's suitable for Ken Burns effects\n   - `select_optimal_effect()`: Automatically selects the best effect based on image aspect ratio and text content\n   - `generate_ffmpeg_command()`: Generates the FFmpeg command with appropriate zoompan filters\n   - `apply_ken_burns_ffmpeg()`: Main entry point that applies the effect to an image\n\n3. **Content-Aware Selection** (`CONTENT_EFFECT_MAPPING`):\n   - Detects keywords in scene text to choose appropriate effects:\n     - Money/funding keywords â†’ zoom effects\n     - Tech/innovation keywords â†’ upward pan effects  \n     - People/team keywords â†’ subtle zoom\n     - News/announcement keywords â†’ dynamic effects\n     - Growth/scaling keywords â†’ upward pan effects\n\n### Integration Points\n\n1. **Overlay Video Assembler** (`/Users/erniesg/code/erniesg/wanx/backend/video_pipeline/overlay_video_assembler.py`):\n   - Lines 285-316: Checks for `ken_burns_effect` in scene data\n   - Applies Ken Burns to STOCK_IMAGE visual types\n   - Falls back to regular image processing if Ken Burns fails\n\n2. **Scene Timing Validator** (`/Users/erniesg/code/erniesg/wanx/backend/video_pipeline/scene_timing_validator.py`):\n   - Lines 198-204: Validates and clamps Ken Burns duration overrides\n   - Ensures Ken Burns duration doesn't exceed scene duration\n\n### How Ken Burns Effects Work\n\n1. **FFmpeg zoompan filter**: The core mechanism uses FFmpeg's `zoompan` filter with parameters:\n   - `z`: Zoom level (1.0 = no zoom)\n   - `x`, `y`: Pan position coordinates\n   - `d`: Duration in frames\n   - `s`: Output size\n   - `fps`: Frame rate\n\n2. **Progressive animations**:\n   - Zoom in: `z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+{increment},{max_zoom})'` - maintains continuity between frames\n   - Zoom out: `z='{start_zoom}-(on/{frames})*({start_zoom}-{end_zoom})'` - smooth zoom out\n   - Pan: Adjusts x/y coordinates over time based on `on` (frame counter)\n\n3. **Aspect ratio handling**:\n   - Portrait images: Scale to fit, pad if needed\n   - Landscape images: Scale to height, crop width\n   - Square images: Flexible positioning\n\n### Configuration Options\n\nKen Burns effects can be configured in scene data:\n```python\n{\n    \"visual_type\": \"STOCK_IMAGE\",\n    \"ken_burns_effect\": {\n        \"type\": \"zoom_in\",          # Effect type or \"auto\" for automatic selection\n        \"intensity\": \"normal\",       # subtle/normal/dramatic\n        \"zoom_amount\": 1.5,         # Override zoom level (1.1-2.0)\n        \"pan_speed\": 1.2,           # Override pan speed (0.5-2.0)\n        \"duration_override\": 5.0    # Override duration (clamped to scene duration)\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### Recent Improvements (from git log)\n- Fixed zoompan snapping issues for continuity across segments\n- Added simple pan effects without zoom\n- Fixed pan duration calculations using frame-based timing\n- Added positioned zoom effects for precise control\n- Eliminated jarring zoom_out transitions\n\nThe Ken Burns implementation provides professional cinematic motion to static images, automatically selecting appropriate effects based on content and image characteristics while maintaining smooth transitions throughout the video."}]}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"6fd1e214-c087-4583-85bc-80fc6d982ab0"}

canvas.width / rect.width;\n   206â†’    const scaleY = canvas.height / rect.height;\n   207â†’    \n   208â†’    return {\n   209â†’      x: (e.clientX - rect.left) * scaleX,\n   210â†’      y: => {\n   237â†’      const canvas = canvasRef.current;\n   238â†’      if (!canvas) return false;\n   239â†’      const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');\n   240â†’      if (!ctx) return false;\n   241â†’      \n   242â†’      ctx.font = `${textEl.fontSize}px Arial`;\n   243â†’      const metrics = ctx.measureText(textEl.text);\n   244â†’      \n   245â†’      return x >= textEl.x - 4 && x <= textEl.x + metrics.width + 4 &&\n   246â†’             y >= textEl.y - textEl.fontSize - 2 && y <= textEl.y + 4;\n   247â†’    });\n   248â†’\n   249â†’    if (clickedText) {\n   250â†’ clickedPath = drawingPaths.find(pathData => {\n   257â†’      return pathData.path.some(point => {\n   258â†’        const distance = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(x - point.x, 2) + Math.pow(y - point.y, 2));\n   259â†’        return distance <= pathData.width + 5; // 5px tolerance\n   260â†’      });\n   261â†’    });\n   262â†’\n   263â†’    if (clickedPath) {\n   264â†’      setSelectedElementId(clickedPath.id);\n   265â†’      setSelectedElementType('drawing');\n   266â†’    } else {\n   267â†’      setSelectedElementId(null);\n   268â†’      setSelectedElementType(null);\n   269â†’    }\n   270â†’  };\n   271â†’\n   272â†’  const handleTextInputSubmit = () => {\n   273â†’    if (currentTextInput.trim()) {\n   274â†’      if (editingTextId) {\n   275â†’        // Update existing text\n   276â†’        setTextElements(prev => prev.map(el => \n   277â†’          el.id === editingTextId \n   278â†’            ? { ...el, text: currentTextInput }\n   279â†’            : el\n   280â†’        ));\n   281â†’        setEditingTextId(null);\n   282â†’      } else {\n   283â†’        // Add new text\n   284â†’        const newTextElement: TextElement = {\n   285â†’          id: Date.now().toString(),\n   286â†’          x: textInputPosition.x,\n   287â†’          y: textInputPosition.y,\n   288â†’          text: currentTextInput,\n   289â†’          fontSize: 16,\n   290â†’          color: '#374151'\n   291â†’        };\n   292â†’        setTextElements(prev => [...prev, newTextElement]);\n   293â†’      }\n   294â†’    }\n   295â†’    \n   296â†’    setIsAddingText(false);\n   297â†’    setCurrentTextInput('');\n   298â†’  };\n   299â†’\n   300â†’  const handleTextInputKeyDown = (e: React.KeyboardEvent) => {\n   301â†’    if (e.key === 'Enter') {\n   302â†’      handleTextInputSubmit();\n   303â†’    } else if (e.key === 'Escape') {\n   304â†’      setIsAddingText(false);\n   305â†’      setCurrentTextInput('');\n   306â†’      setEditingTextId(null);\n   307â†’    }\n   308â†’  };\n   309â†’\n   310â†’  const editSelectedText = () => {\n   311â†’    if (selectedElementId && selectedElementType === 'text') {\n   312â†’      const textElement = textElements.find(el => el.id === selectedElementId);\n   313â†’      if (textElement) {\n   314â†’        setEditingTextId(textElement.id);\n   315â†’        setCurrentTextInput(textElement.text);\n   316â†’        setTextInputPosition({ x: textElement.x, y: textElement.y });\n   317â†’        setIsAddingText(true);\n   318â†’        setTimeout(() => {\n   319â†’          textInputRef.current?.focus();\n   320â†’        }, 0);\n   321â†’      }\n   322â†’    }\n   323â†’  };\n   324â†’\n   325â†’  const deleteSelected = () => {\n   326â†’    if (selectedElementId) {\n   327â†’      if (selectedElementType === 'text') {\n   328â†’        setTextElements(prev => prev.filter(el => el.id !== selectedElementId));\n   329â†’      } else if (selectedElementType === 'drawing') {\n   330â†’        setDrawingPaths(prev => prev.filter(path => path.id !== selectedElementId));\n   331â†’      }\n   332â†’      setSelectedElementId(null);\n   333â†’      setSelectedElementType(null);\n   334â†’    }\n   335â†’  };\n   336â†’\n   337â†’  const filteredModules = learningModules.filter(module => {\n   338â†’    const topicMatch = selectedTopic === 'all' || module.topic === selectedTopic;\n   339â†’    const typeMatch = selectedType === 'all' || module.type === selectedType;\n   340â†’    return topicMatch && typeMatch;\n   341â†’  });\n   342â†’\n   343â†’  const startModule = (moduleId: string) => {\n   344â†’    setActiveModule(moduleId);\n   345â†’    setVideoProgress(0);\n   346â†’    setIsVideoPlaying(false);\n   347â†’    setQuizAnswer('');\n   348â†’    clearWorkArea();\n   349â†’  };\n   350â†’\n   351â†’  const closeModule = () => {\n   352â†’    setActiveModule(null);\n   353â†’    setIsVideoPlaying(false);\n   354â†’    setShowPersonalizedVideos(false);\n   355â†’  };\n   356â†’\n   357â†’  const toggleVideo = () => {\n   358â†’    setIsVideoPlaying(!isVideoPlaying);\n   359â†’    if (!isVideoPlaying) {\n   360â†’      const interval = setInterval(() => {\n   361â†’        setVideoProgress(prev => {\n   362â†’          if (prev >= 100) {\n   363â†’            clearInterval(interval);\n   364â†’            setShowPersonalizedVideos(true);\n   365â†’            return 100;\n   366â†’          }\n   367â†’          return prev + 2;\n   368â†’        });\n   369â†’      }, 200);\n   370â†’    }\n   371â†’  };\n   372â†’\n   373â†’  const startDrawing = (e: React.MouseEvent<HTMLCanvasElement>) => {\n   374â†’    if (workAreaMode !== 'draw') return;\n   375â†’    \n   376â†’    const { x, y } = getCanvasCoordinates(e);\n   377â†’    setIsDrawing(true);\n   378â†’    setCurrentPath([{ x, y }]);\n   379â†’  };\n   380â†’\n   381â†’  const draw = (e: React.MouseEvent<HTMLCanvasElement>) => {\n   382â†’    if (!isDrawing || workAreaMode !== 'draw') return;\n   383â†’\n   384â†’    const { x, y } = getCanvasCoordinates(e);\n   385â†’    setCurrentPath(prev => [...prev, { x, y }]);\n   386â†’\n   387â†’    const canvas = canvasRef.current;\n   388â†’    if (!canvas) return;\n   389â†’    const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');\n   390â†’    if (!ctx) return;\n   391â†’\n   392â†’    ctx.lineCap = 'round';\n   393â†’    ctx.lineJoin = 'round';\n   394â†’    ctx.strokeStyle = '#374151';\n   395â†’    ctx.lineWidth = 2;\n   396â†’    \n   397â†’    if (currentPath.length > 0) {\n   398â†’      const lastPoint = currentPath[currentPath.length - 1];\n   399â†’      ctx.beginPath();\n   400â†’      ctx.moveTo(lastPoint.x, lastPoint.y);\n   401â†’      ctx.lineTo(x, y);\n   402â†’      ctx.stroke();\n   403â†’    }\n   404â†’  };\n   405â†’\n   406â†’  const stopDrawing = () => {\n   407â†’    if (isDrawing && currentPath.length > 1) {\n   408â†’      const newPath: DrawingPath = {\n   409â†’        id: Date.now().toString(),\n   410â†’        path: currentPath,\n   411â†’        color: '#374151',\n   412â†’        width: 2\n   413â†’      };\n   414â†’      setDrawingPaths(prev => [...prev, newPath]);\n   415â†’    }\n   416â†’    \n   417â†’    setIsDrawing(false);\n   418â†’    setCurrentPath([]);\n   419â†’  };\n   420â†’\n   421â†’  const clearWorkArea = () => {\n   422â†’    setTextElements([]);\n   423â†’    setDrawingPaths([]);\n   424â†’    setSelectedElementId(null);\n   425â†’    setSelectedElementType(null);\n   426â†’    setIsAddingText(false);\n   427â†’    setEditingTextId(null);\n   428â†’    redrawCanvas();\n   429â†’  };\n   430â†’\n   431â†’  const getCursorStyle = () => {\n   432â†’    switch (workAreaMode) {\n   433â†’      case 'text': return 'cursor-text';\n   434â†’      case 'draw': return 'cursor-crosshair';\n   435â†’      case 'select': return 'cursor-pointer';\n   436â†’      default: return 'cursor-default';\n   437â†’    }\n   438â†’  };\n   439â†’\n   440â†’  const getTypeIcon = (type: string) => {\n   441â†’    switch (type) {\n   442â†’      case 'video': return <Video size={16} />;\n   443â†’      case 'interactive': return <Play size={16} />;\n   444â†’      case 'notes': return <FileText size={16} />;\n   445â†’      default: return <BookOpen size={16} />;\n   446â†’    }\n   447â†’  };\n   448â†’\n   449â†’  const getDifficultyColor = (difficulty: string) => {\n   450â†’    switch (difficulty) {\n   451â†’      case 'easy': return 'bg-green-100 text-green-800';\n   452â†’      case 'medium': return 'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800';\n   453â†’      case 'hard': return 'bg-red-100 text-red-800';\n   454â†’      default: return 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-800';\n   455â†’    }\n   456â†’  };\n   457â†’\n   458â†’  const activeModuleData = learningModules.find(m => m.id === activeModule);\n   459â†’\n   460â†’  if (activeModule && activeModuleData) {\n   461â†’    return (\n   462â†’      <div className=\"min-h-screen bg-gray-50\">\n   463â†’        <Navigation />\n   464â†’        \n   465â†’        <main className=\"max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 py-8\">\n   466â†’          <div className=\"flex items-center justify-between mb-6\">\n   467â†’            <div>\n   468â†’              <h1 className=\"text-2xl font-bold text-gray-900\">{activeModuleData.title}</h1>\n   469â†’              <p className=\"text-gray-600\">{activeModuleData.description}</p>\n   470â†’            </div>\n   471â†’            <button\n   472â†’              onClick={closeModule}\n   473â†’ </button>\n   477â†’          </div>\n   478â†’\n   479â†’          <div className=\"grid lg:grid-cols-2 gap-8\">\n   480â†’            <div className=\"space-y-6\">\n   481â†’              <div className=\"w-16 h-16 bg-white/20 hover:bg-white/30 rounded-full flex items-center justify-center transition-colors\"\n   487â†’                    >\n   488â†’                      {isVideoPlaying ? 506â†’                  </div>\n   507â†’                </div>\n   508â†’              </div>\n   509â†’\n   510â†’              {activeModuleData.hasQuiz && videoProgress > 50 && (\n   511â†’        </div>\n   559â†’                    ))}\n   560â†’                  </div>\n   561â†’                </div>\n   562â†’              )}\n   563â†’            </div>\n   564â†’\n   565â†’             placeholder=\"Type here...\"\n   663â†’                    />\n   664â†’                  )}\n   665â†’                </div>\n   666â†’\n   667â†’                <div className=\"mt-4 </p>\n   680â†’                    )}\n   681â†’                    {workAreaMode === 'select' && (\n   682â†’                      <p className=\"flex items-center\">\n   683â†’ </div>\n   705â†’    );\n   706â†’  }\n   707â†’\n   708â†’  return (\n   709â†’    <div className=\"min-h-screen bg-gray-50\">\n   710â†’      <Navigation />\n   711â†’      \n   712â†’      <main               <option key={topic} value={topic}>{topic}</option>\n   732â†’                ))}\n   733â†’              </select>\n   734â†’            </div>\n   735â†’            \n   736â†’            <div>\n   737â†’              <label className=\"block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-2\">Content Type</label>\n   738â†’              <select\n   739â†’                value={selectedType}\n                <option value=\"interactive\">Interactive Primers</option>\n   746â†’                <option value=\"notes\">Study Notes</option>\n   747â†’              </select>\n   748â†’ Set timing\n   198â†’        audio_clip = audio_clip.set_start(start_time)\n   199â†’        \n   200â†’        # If the sound is shorter than the duration, it will play once\n   201â†’        # If the sound is longer, it will be cut to fit the duration\n   202â†’        if audio_clip.duration > duration:\n   203â†’            audio_clip = audio_clip.subclip(0, duration)\n   204â†’        \n   205â†’        logger.info(f\"Created sound clip: {sound_filename} (duration: {audio_clip.duration:.2f}s, volume: {volume})\")\n   206â†’        return audio_clip\n   207â†’        \n   208â†’    except Exception as e:\n   209â†’        logger.error(f\"Failed to create sound clip from {sound_filename}: {e}\")\n   210â†’        return None\n   211â†’\n   212â†’\n   213â†’def add_sound_to_text_effect(\n   214â†’    text_animation_clip,\n   215â†’    effect_type: str,\n   216â†’    effect_params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,\n   217â†’    text_content: str = \"\",\n   218â†’    custom_sound: Optional[str] = None,\n   219â†’    sound_volume: float = 0.3,\n   220â†’    sound_delay: float = 0.0\n   221â†’):\n   222â†’    \"\"\"\n   223â†’    Add sound to a text animation clip\n   224â†’    \n   225â†’    Args:\n   226â†’        text_animation_clip: The MoviePy text animation clip\n   227â†’        effect_type: Type of text effect\n   228â†’        effect_params: Parameters of the effect\n   229â†’        text_content: The text content for contextual sound detection\n   230â†’        custom_sound: Optional custom sound file\n   231â†’        sound_volume: Volume level for the sound (0.0 to 1.0)\n   232â†’        sound_delay: Delay before sound starts (seconds)\n   233â†’        \n   234â†’    Returns:\n   235â†’        The text animation clip with audio attached, or original clip if no sound\n   236â†’    \"\"\"\n   237â†’    # Attach audio to the text animation\n   262â†’    try:\n   263â†’        text_animation_with_sound = text_animation_clip.set_audio(sound_clip)\n   264â†’        logger.info(f\"Successfully added sound to text effect: {sound_filename}\")\n   265â†’        return text_animation_with_sound\n   266â†’    except Exception as e:\n   267â†’        logger.error(f\"Failed to attach sound to text animation: {e}\")\n   268â†’        return text_animation_clip\n   269â†’\n   270â†’\n   271â†’# Convenience functions for direct use\n   272â†’def get_fade_sound(text_content: str = \"\", custom_sound: Optional[str] = None) -> Optional[str]:\n   273â†’    \"\"\"Get sound for fade effects\"\"\"\n   274â†’    return get_sound_for_effect(\"TEXT_OVERLAY_FADE\", text_content=text_content, custom_sound=custom_sound)\n   275â†’\n   276â†’\n   277â†’def get_scale_sound(start_scale: float = 1.0, end_scale: float = 1.0, text_content: str = \"\", custom_sound: Optional[str] = None) -> Optional[str]:\n   278â†’    \"\"\"Get sound for scale effects\"\"\"\n   279â†’    effect_params = {\"start_scale\": start_scale, \"end_scale\": end_scale}\n   280â†’    return get_sound_for_effect(\"TEXT_OVERLAY_SCALE\", effect_params=effect_params, text_content=text_content, custom_sound=custom_sound)\n   281â†’\n   282â†’\n   283â†’if __name__ == \"__main__\":\n   284â†’    # {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01J3PevzEyA9TfN4TUah8FJv","type":"tool_result","content":"     1â†’import os\n     2â†’import requests\n     3â†’import logging\n     4â†’from dotenv import load_dotenv\n     5â†’import random\n     6â†’\n     7â†’# Configure logging\n     8â†’logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')\n     9â†’logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n    10â†’\n    11â†’# Define usable licenses\n    12â†’USABLE_LICENSES = [\"Creative Commons 0\", \"Attribution\"]\n    13â†’\n    14â†’def find_and_download_music(api_key: str, query: str, output_path: str, min_duration: float = 60, max_duration: float = 180) -> str | None:\n    15â†’    \"\"\"\n    16â†’    Search Freesound for music and download the HQ MP3 preview of the first suitable result.\n    17â†’\n    18â†’    Args:\n    19â†’        api_key (str): Your Freesound API key.\n    20â†’        query (str): The search query (e.g., \"ambient electronic background\").\n    21â†’        output_path (str): Full path including filename to save the downloaded music.\n    22â†’        min_duration (float): Minimum duration in seconds. Default: 60.\n    23â†’        max_duration (float): Maximum duration in seconds. Default: 180.\n    24â†’\n    25â†’    Returns:\n    26â†’        str | None: The path to the downloaded file if successful, otherwise None.\n    27â†’    \"\"\"\n    28â†’    if not api_key:\n    29â†’        logger.error(\"Freesound API key is missing.\")\n    30â†’        return None\n    31â†’\n    32â†’    search_url = \"https://freesound.org/apiv2/search/text/\"\n    33â†’    # Freesound uses Token authentication for basic API key access\n    34â†’    headers = {\"Authorization\": f\"Token {api_key}\"}\n    35â†’\n    36â†’    # Construct the filter string\n    37â†’    license_filter_parts = [f'license:\"{name}\"' for name in USABLE_LICENSES]\n    38â†’    license_filter = \" OR \".join(license_filter_parts)\n    39â†’    duration_filter = f\"duration:[{min_duration} TO {max_duration}]\"\n    40â†’    combined_filter = f\"({license_filter}) AND {duration_filter}\"\n    41â†’\n    42â†’    params = {\n    43â†’        \"query\": query,\n    44â†’        \"filter\": combined_filter,\n    45â†’        \"fields\": \"id,name,license,previews,duration\", # Request needed fields\n    46â†’        \"sort\": \"rating_desc\", # Sort by rating\n    47â†’        \"page_size\": 10 # Get a few results to check\n    48â†’    }\n    49â†’\n    50â†’    try:\n    51â†’        logger.info(f\"Searching Freesound for '{query}' with filters: {combined_filter}\")\n    52â†’        response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, params=params, timeout=15)\n    53â†’        response.raise_for_status() # Raise an exception for bad status codes\n    54â†’\n    55â†’        data = response.json()\n    56â†’        results = data.get(\"results\", [])\n    57â†’\n    58â†’        if not results:\n    59â†’            logger.warning(f\"No suitable music found for query: '{query}' matching criteria.\")\n    60â†’            return None\n    61â†’\n    62â†’        logger.info(f\"Found {len(results)} potential sounds for '{query}'. Key features include:\n\n- **Sound Mappings**: Pre-defined sound effects for different text animation types:\n  - `TEXT_OVERLAY_FADE`: fade_in.wav, fade_out.wav\n  - `TEXT_OVERLAY_SCALE`: zoom_in.wav, zoom_out.wav\n  - `TEXT_OVERLAY_TYPEWRITER`: typewriter.wav\n  - `TEXT_OVERLAY_CHIME`: chime.wav\n  - `TEXT_OVERLAY_PAGE`: turn_page.wav\n  - `TEXT_OVERLAY_CASH`: cash_register.wav\n\n- **Context-Aware Sound Selection**: Automatically selects sounds based on text content:\n  - Money keywords (e.g., \"$\", \"million\", \"funding\") â†’ cash_register.wav\n  - Tech keywords (e.g., \"AI\", \"startup\", \"crypto\") â†’ chime.wav\n  - Notification keywords (e.g., \"new\", \"breaking\", \"alert\") â†’ typewriter.wav\n\n- **Key Functions**:\n  - `get_sound_for_effect()`: Determines appropriate sound based on effect type and text content\n  - `create_sound_clip()`: Creates MoviePy audio clips with configurable volume and timing\n  - `add_sound_to_text_effect()`: Attaches sound to text animation clips\n\n### 2. **Background Music Integration** (`backend/text_to_video/editor.py`)\nThe video editor includes background music functionality:\n\n- **Function**: Music is added during the video assembly process\n- **Features**:\n  - Automatic looping if music is shorter than video\n  - Automatic trimming if music is longer than video\n  - Volume control (default: 0.15 or 15% volume)\n  - Mixed with voice track using `CompositeAudioClip`\n\n### 3. **FreeSound Integration** (`backend/text_to_video/freesound_client.py`)\nExternal sound/music sourcing capability:\n\n- **Function**: `find_and_download_music()`\n- **Features**:\n  - Searches FreeSound API for music/sounds\n  - Filters by license (Creative Commons 0, Attribution)\n  - Duration filtering (default: 60-180 seconds)\n  - Downloads high-quality MP3 previews\n\n### 4. **Sound Asset Storage**\n- **Location**: `/backend/assets/sound/`\n- **Available sound files**:\n  - cash_register.wav\n  - chime.wav\n  - text_fade_in.wav\n  - text_fade_out.wav\n  - text_zoom_in.wav\n  - text_zoom_out.wav.wav (note: double extension)\n  - turn_page.wav\n  - typewriter.wav\n\n### 5. **Integration Points**\n\n**Text Animations** (`text_animations.py`):\n- `animate_text_fade()` and `animate_text_scale()` accept:\n  - `enable_sound`: Boolean to enable/disable sound (default: True)\n  - `sound_volume`: Volume level 0.0-1.0 (default: 0.3)\n  - `custom_sound`: Override default sound selection\n  - `sound_delay`: Delay before sound starts\n\n**Video Assembly**:\n- Background music is added during the final assembly phase\n- Music path can be specified in orchestration summaries\n- Volume is configurable per workflow\n\n### 6. **Usage Examples**\n\n```python\n# Text animation with automatic sound selection\nanimate_text_fade(\n    text_content=\"$33 million raised\",  # Will use cash_register.wav\n    enable_sound=True,\n    sound_volume=0.4\n)\n\n# Text animation with custom sound\nanimate_text_scale(\n    text_content=\"Breaking news\",\n    custom_sound=\"typewriter.wav\",\n    sound_volume=0.5\n)\n\n# Background music in video assembly\n# Added automatically if music_path is provided in orchestration summary\n```\n\nThe sound effects system is well-integrated into the video pipeline, providing both automatic context-aware sound selection for text animations and background music capabilities for the final video output."}]}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"52316940-148e-4ea3-a52f-854842245e55"}

No existing video found\n   111â†’    logger.info(f\"No existing Argil video found for job {unique_run_id}\")\n   112â†’    return None\n   113â†’\n   114â†’async def apply_speed_adjustment_to_argil_video(\n   115â†’    argil_video_path: pathlib.Path,\n   116â†’    output_dir: pathlib.Path,\n   117â†’    config: dict,\n   118â†’    speed_factor: float = 1.0\n   119â†’) -> pathlib.Path | None:\n   120â†’    \"\"\"\n   121â†’    Apply speed adjustment to Argil video before transcription.\n   122â†’    \n   123â†’    Args:\n   124â†’        argil_video_path: Path to original Argil video\n   125â†’        output_dir: Directory to save speed-adjusted video\n   126â†’        config: Pipeline configuration\n   127â†’        speed_factor: Speed multiplier (default 1.0 = no change)\n   128â†’        \n   129â†’    Returns:\n   130â†’        Path to speed-adjusted video or None if failed/disabled\n   131â†’    \"\"\"\n   132â†’    try:\n   133â†’        speed_config = load_speed_config()\n   134â†’        \n   135â†’        # Check if speed adjustment is enabled and needed\n   136â†’        if not speed_config.get('enabled', True):\n   137â†’            logger.info(\"Speed adjustment disabled in config\")\n   138â†’            return None\n   139â†’            \n   140â†’        # Use provided speed_factor, but respect max limit\n   141â†’        if speed_factor == 1.0:\n   142â†’            speed_factor = speed_config.get('default_factor', 1.2)\n   143â†’            \n   144â†’        speed_factor = min(speed_factor, speed_config.get('max_factor', 2.0))\n   145â†’        \n   146â†’        if speed_factor == 1.0:\n   147â†’            logger.info(\"Speed factor is 1.0, no adjustment needed\")\n   148â†’            return None\n   149â†’            \n   150â†’        preserve_pitch = speed_config.get('preserve_pitch', True)\n   151â†’        \n   152â†’        # Guide ---\n   320â†’\n   321â†’def build_asset_guide_gdoc_requests(scene_plan: list, unique_run_id: str, job_gdrive_folder_url: str, script_data=None):\n   322â†’    \"\"\"Builds the request body for creating a formatted Asset Guide GDoc.\"\"\"\n   323â†’    requests = []\n   324â†’    current_index = 1\n   325â†’\n   326â†’    def insert_text(text, style=None, bold=False, link_url=None, is_heading=False):\n   327â†’        nonlocal current_index, requests\n   328â†’        effective_text = text + '\\n' if is_heading or text.endswith('\\n') else text\n   329â†’        text_len = \"namedStyleType\"}})\n   333â†’        if bold:\n   334â†’            requests.append({\"updateTextStyle\": {\"range\": {\"startIndex\": current_index, \"endIndex\": current_index + insert_text(\"\\n\", is_heading=True)\n   372â†’\n   373â†’    # Group overlays by section if possible (look for section in scene_id or add logic if available)\n   374â†’    # For now, just list in Create the Google Doc\n   412â†’        file_name = f\"{unique_run_id}_Asset_Upload_Guide\"\n   413â†’        doc = docs_service.documents().create(body={\"title\": file_name}).execute()\n   414â†’        doc_id = doc.get('documentId')\n   415â†’        doc_url = f\"https://docs.google.com/document/d/{doc_id}/edit\"\n   416â†’\n   417â†’        # Build and send content requests\n   418â†’        requests = build_asset_guide_gdoc_requests(scene_plan, unique_run_id, job_gdrive_folder_url, script_data)\n   419â†’        if requests:\n   420â†’            docs_service.documents().batchUpdate(documentId=doc_id, body={\"requests\": requests}).execute()\n   421â†’\n   422â†’        # Move to the correct job folder in GDrive\n   423â†’        drive_service.files().update(\n   424â†’            fileId=doc_id,\n   425â†’            addParents=job_gdrive_folder_id,\n   426â†’            removeParents='root',\n   427â†’            fields='id, parents'\n   428â†’        ).execute()\n   429â†’\n   430â†’        # Share with the domain\n   431â†’        drive_service.permissions().create(\n   432â†’            fileId=doc_id,\n   433â†’            body={'type': 'domain', 'role': 'writer', 'domain': 'techinasia.com'},\n   434â†’            sendNotificationEmail=False\n   435â†’        ).execute()\n   436â†’\n   437â†’        logger.info(f\"Asset guide GDoc created and uploaded successfully: {doc_url}\")\n   438â†’        return doc_url\n   439â†’    except HttpError as e:\n   440â†’        logger.error(f\"Google API error while generating asset guide GDoc: {e}\", exc_info=True)\n   441â†’        return None\n   442â†’    except Exception as e:\n   443â†’        logger.error(f\"Unexpected error generating asset guide GDoc: {e}\", exc_info=True)\n   444â†’        return None\n   445â†’\n   446â†’# --- Main Pipeline Logic (Refactored for Modularity) ---\n   447â†’\n   448â†’async def run_scene_generation_pipeline(\n   449â†’    script_path: pathlib.Path,\n   450â†’    output_dir: pathlib.Path,\n   451â†’    unique_run_id: str,\n   452â†’    drive_service,\n   453â†’    docs_service,\n   454â†’    job_gdrive_folder_id: str,\n   455â†’    job_gdrive_folder_url: str,\n   456â†’    config: dict\n   457â†’):\n   458â†’    \"\"\"\n   459â†’    Runs the pipeline from a finalized script JSON through to generating the asset guide.\n   460â†’    Returns the URL of the generated asset guide GDoc.\n   461â†’    \"\"\"\n   462â†’    # Initialize API clients\n   463â†’    from scripts.config_manager import ConfigManager\n   464â†’    anthropic_api_key = ConfigManager.get_env_var(\"ANTHROPIC_API_KEY\")\n   465â†’    argil_api_key = ConfigManager.get_env_var(\"ARGIL_API_KEY\")\n   466â†’    if not all([anthropic_api_key, argil_api_key]):\n   467â†’        raise ValueError(\"API keys for Anthropic or Argil are missing from environment variables.\")\n   468â†’    llm_config = config.get('llm_scene_planner', {})\n   469â†’    claude_model = llm_config.get(\"MODEL_NAME\", \"claude-sonnet-4-20250514\")\n   470â†’    claude_client = ClaudeClient(model=claude_model)\n   471â†’\n   472â†’    # --- Pipeline Steps ---\n   473â†’    try:\n   474â†’        # Step 1: Load Finalised Script\n   475â†’        logger.info(f\"--- Step 1: Loading finalised script from: {script_path} ---\")\n   476â†’        with open(script_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:\n   477â†’            script_data = json.load(f)\n   478â†’\n   479â†’        # Step 2: Generate Argil Avatar Video\n   480â†’        logger.info(\"--- Step 2: Generating Argil Avatar Video (Internal TTS) ---\")\n   481â†’        \n   482â†’        # Get Google Sheets service and spreadsheet ID for Argil video ID tracking\n   483â†’        sheets_service = None\n   484â†’        spreadsheet_id = None\n   485â†’        try:\n   486â†’            from scripts.config_manager import ConfigManager\n   487â†’            config_data = ConfigManager.get_config()\n   488â†’            env = config_data.get('env', 'PROD').upper()\n   489â†’            gsheets_config = config_data.get('google_sheets', {})\n   490â†’            spreadsheet_id = gsheets_config.get(f'spreadsheet_id_{env.lower()}')\n   491â†’            \n   492â†’            #
