Skipping warning notification.\")\n   158â†’        return\n   159â†’\n   160â†’    # Get config from ConfigManager\n   161â†’    from scripts.config_manager import ConfigManager\n   162â†’    config = ConfigManager.get_config()\n   163â†’\n   164â†’    notification_channel_id = config.get('slack', {}).get('notification_channel_id')\n   165â†’    if not notification_channel_id:\n   166â†’        logger.warning(\"Slack notification_channel_id not set. Cannot send warning notification.\")\n   167â†’        return\n   168â†’\n   169â†’    warning_emoji = \":warning:\" if warning_type == \"missing_music\" else \":exclamation:\"\n   170â†’\n   171â†’    message = (\n   172â†’        f\"{warning_emoji} *Video Production Warning*\\n\\n\"\n   173â†’        f\"*Job ID:* `{job_id}`\\n\"\n   174â†’        f\"*Article Title:* {article_title}\\n\"\n   175â†’        f\"*Issue:* {warning_type.replace('_', ' ').title()}\\n\\n\"\n   176â†’        f\"{details}\\n\\n\"\n   177â†’        f\"The video will still be created, but please review the output quality.\"\n   178â†’    )\n   179â†’\n   180â†’    try:\n   181â†’        slack_client.chat_postMessage(channel=notification_channel_id, text=message, mrkdwn=True)\n   182â†’        logger.info(f\"Sent Slack warning notification for Job ID: {job_id} - {warning_type}\")\n   183â†’    except SlackApiError as e:\n   184â†’        logger.error(f\"Slack API error sending warning notification for {job_id}: {e.response['error']}\")\n   185â†’\n   186â†’def download_gdrive_folder_contents_recursive(drive_service, folder_id: str, local_dest_path: Path, current_folder_path: str = \"\"):\n   187â†’    \"\"\"Downloads all files from a GDrive folder recursively, flattening to local destination with folder prefixes.\"\"\"\n   188â†’    logger.info(f\"Downloading contents of GDrive folder '{folder_id}' to '{local_dest_path}' with prefix '{current_folder_path}'...\")\n   189â†’    local_dest_path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n   190â†’\n   191â†’    page_token = None\n   192â†’    files_downloaded = 0\n   193â†’    while True:\n   194â†’        response = drive_service.files().list(\n   195â†’            q=f\"'{folder_id}' in parents and trashed=false\",\n   196â†’            spaces='drive',\n   197â†’            fields='nextPageToken, files(id, name, mimeType)',\n   198â†’            pageToken=page_token\n   199â†’        ).execute()\n   200â†’\n   201â†’        for file in response.get('files', []):\n   202â†’            file_id = file.get('id')\n   203â†’            file_name = file.get('name')\n   204â†’            mime_type = file.get('mimeType')\n   205â†’\n   206â†’            # Handle folders recursively\n   207â†’            if mime_type == 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder':\n   208â†’                subfolder_path = f\"{current_folder_path}_{file_name}\" if current_folder_path else file_name\n   209â†’                logger.info(f\"Found subfolder '{file_name}', descending with prefix '{subfolder_path}'...\")\n   210â†’                sub_files = download_gdrive_folder_contents_recursive(drive_service, file_id, local_dest_path, subfolder_path)\n   211â†’                files_downloaded += sub_files\n   212â†’                continue\n   213â†’\n   214â†’            # Handle files with folder prefix\n   215â†’            if current_folder_path:\n   216â†’                prefixed_filename = f\"{current_folder_path}_{file_name}\"\n   217â†’            else:\n   218â†’                prefixed_filename = file_name\n   219â†’\n   220â†’            local_file_path = local_dest_path / prefixed_filename\n   221â†’\n   222â†’            if local_file_path.exists():\n   223â†’                logger.info(f\"Skipping '{prefixed_filename}' - already exists locally.\")\n   224â†’                files_downloaded += 1\n   225â†’                continue\n   226â†’\n   227â†’            logger.info(f\"Downloading '{file_name}' as '{prefixed_filename}' (ID: {file_id})...\")\n   228â†’            request = drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id)\n   229â†’            fh = BytesIO()\n   230â†’            downloader = MediaIoBaseDownload(fh, request)\n   231â†’            done = False\n   232â†’            while done is False:\n   233â†’                status, done = downloader.next_chunk()\n   234â†’                logger.debug(f\"Download {int(status.progress() * 100)}%.\")\n   235â†’\n   236â†’            with open(local_file_path, 'wb') as f:\n   237â†’                f.write(fh.getvalue())\n   238â†’            logger.info(f\"Successfully downloaded to '{local_file_path}'.\")\n   239â†’            files_downloaded += 1\n   240â†’\n   241â†’        page_token = response.get('nextPageToken', None)\n   242â†’        if page_token is None:\n   243â†’            break\n   244â†’\n   245â†’    return files_downloaded\n   246â†’\n   247â†’def count_gdrive_assets_recursive(drive_service, folder_id: str, current_path: str = \"\") -> dict:\n   248â†’    \"\"\"Count assets in Google Drive folder recursively, returning structure and counts.\"\"\"\n   249â†’    ASSET_TYPES = {\n   250â†’        \"video\": [\".mp4\", \".mov\", \".avi\"],\n   251â†’        \"image\": [\".jpg\", \".jpeg\", \".png\"],\n   252â†’        \"audio\": [\".mp3\", \".wav\", \".m4a\"]\n   253â†’    }\n   254â†’\n   255â†’    structure = {\"files\": [], \"folders\": {}, \"counts\": {key: 0 for key in ASSET_TYPES}}\n   256â†’\n   257â†’    try:\n   258â†’        page_token = None\n   259â†’        while True:\n   260â†’            response = drive_service.files().list(\n   261â†’                q=f\"'{folder_id}' in parents and trashed=false\",\n   262â†’                spaces='drive',\n   263â†’                fields='nextPageToken, files(id, name, mimeType)',\n   264â†’                pageToken=page_token\n   265â†’            ).execute()\n   266â†’\n   267â†’            for file_obj in response.get('files', []):\n   268â†’                file_name = file_obj.get('name', '')\n   269â†’                file_id = file_obj.get('id', '')\n   270â†’                mime_type = file_obj.get('mimeType', '')\n   271â†’\n   272â†’                if mime_type == 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder':\n   273â†’                    # Handle subfolder recursively\n   274â†’                    subfolder_path = f\"{current_path}_{file_name}\" if current_path else file_name\n   275â†’                    structure[\"folders\"][file_name] = count_gdrive_assets_recursive(\n   276â†’                        drive_service, file_id, subfolder_path\n   277â†’                    )\n   278â†’\n   279â†’                    # Add subfolder counts to parent\n   280â†’                    for asset_type in ASSET_TYPES:\n   281â†’                        structure[\"counts\"][asset_type] += structure[\"folders\"][file_name][\"counts\"][asset_type]\n   282â†’                else:\n   283â†’                    # Handle regular file\n   284â†’                    file_ext = Path(file_name).suffix.lower()\n   285â†’                    prefixed_name = f\"{current_path}_{file_name}\" if current_path else file_name\n   286â†’\n   287â†’                    file_info = {\n   288â†’                        \"original_name\": file_name,\n   289â†’                        \"prefixed_name\": prefixed_name,\n   290â†’                        \"path\": current_path,\n   291â†’                        \"type\": \"unknown\"\n   292â†’                    }\n   293â†’\n   294â†’                    for asset_type, extensions in ASSET_TYPES.items():\n   295â†’                        if file_ext in extensions:\n   296â†’                            file_info[\"type\"] = asset_type\n   297â†’                            structure[\"counts\"][asset_type] += 1\n   298â†’                            break\n   299â†’\n   300â†’                    structure[\"files\"].append(file_info)\n   301â†’\n   302â†’            page_token = response.get('nextPageToken', None)\n   303â†’            if page_token is None:\n   304â†’                break\n   305â†’\n   306â†’        return structure\n   307â†’\n   308â†’    except Exception as e:\n   309â†’        logger.error(f\"Error counting assets in Google Drive folder {folder_id}: {e}\")\n   310â†’        return structure\n   311â†’\n   312â†’def log_asset_inventory(structure: dict, indent: int = 0) -> list:\n   313â†’    \"\"\"Log asset inventory in a structured format and return summary lines.\"\"\"\n   314â†’    prefix = \"  \" * indent\n   315â†’    summary_lines = []\n   316â†’\n   317â†’    # Log current level files\n   318â†’    if structure[\"files\"]:\n   319â†’        for file_info in structure[\"files\"]:\n   320â†’            if file_info[\"type\"] != \"unknown\":\n   321â†’                summary_lines.append(f\"{prefix}ðŸ“„ {file_info['prefixed_name']} ({file_info['type'].upper()})\")\n   322â†’\n   323â†’    # Log subfolders\n   324â†’    for folder_name, subfolder_data in structure[\"folders\"].items():\n   325â†’        subfolder_total = sum(subfolder_data[\"counts\"].values())\n   326â†’        if subfolder_total > 0:\n   327â†’            summary_lines.append(f\"{prefix}ðŸ“ {folder_name}/ ({subfolder_total} files)\")\n   328â†’            summary_lines.extend(log_asset_inventory(subfolder_data, indent + 1))\n   329â†’\n   330â†’    return summary_lines\n   331â†’\n   332â†’def download_gdrive_folder_contents(drive_service, folder_id: str, local_dest_path: Path):\n   333â†’    \"\"\"Downloads all files from a GDrive folder to a local destination (wrapper for recursive function).\"\"\"\n   334â†’    # First, get an inventory of what we're about to download\n   335â†’    logger.info(\"--- Pre-Download Asset Inventory ---\")\n   336â†’    asset_structure = count_gdrive_assets_recursive(drive_service, folder_id)\n   337â†’\n   338â†’    total_counts = asset_structure[\"counts\"]\n   339â†’    total_files = sum(total_counts.values())\n   340â†’\n   341â†’    logger.info(f\"Total assets found: {total_files} files\")\n   342â†’    logger.info(f\"  - Videos: {total_counts['video']}\")\n   343â†’    logger.info(f\"  - Images: {total_counts['image']}\")\n   344â†’    logger.info(f\"  - Audio: {total_counts['audio']}\")\n   345â†’\n   346â†’    if total_files > 0:\n   347â†’        logger.info(\"Asset structure preview:\")\n   348â†’        inventory_lines = log_asset_inventory(asset_structure)\n   349â†’        for line in inventory_lines[:20]:  # Limit to first 20 files for readability\n   350â†’            logger.info(f\"  {line}\")\n   351â†’        if len(inventory_lines) > 20:\n   352â†’            logger.info(f\"  ... and {len(inventory_lines) - 20} more files\")\n   353â†’\n   354â†’    # Now proceed with download\n   355â†’    logger.info(\"--- Starting Download ---\")\n   356â†’    files_downloaded = download_gdrive_folder_contents_recursive(drive_service, folder_id, local_dest_path)\n   357â†’    logger.info(f\"Downloaded {files_downloaded} file(s) from GDrive folder and subfolders.\")\n   358â†’\n   359â†’async def main():\n   360â†’    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description=\"Fully automates the final video production: matches assets, assembles the video, and uploads it.\")\n   361â†’    parser.add_argument(\n   362â†’        \"--job_id\",\n   363â†’        type=str,\n   364â†’        required=True,\n   365â†’        help=\"The Job_ID from the 'Job_Status' Google Sheet tab.\"\n   366â†’    )\n   367â†’    parser.add_argument(\n   368â†’        \"--speed_factor\",\n   369â†’        type=float,\n   370â†’        default=None,\n   371â†’        help=\"Speed adjustment factor for the video (e.g., 1.2 for 20%% faster, 0.8 for 20%% slower). Default: uses config default\"\n   372â†’    )\n   373â†’    args = parser.parse_args()\n   374â†’\n   375â†’    job_id = args.job_id\n   376â†’    \n   377â†’    # --- Setup ---\n   378â†’    config = ConfigManager.get_config()\n   379â†’    \n   380â†’    # Set speed factor from config if not provided\n   381â†’    speed_factor = args.speed_factor\n   382â†’    if speed_factor is None:\n   383â†’        speed_config = config.get('speed_adjustment', {})\n   384â†’        if speed_config.get('enabled', True):\n   385â†’            speed_factor = speed_config.get('default_factor', 1.3)\n   386â†’        else:\n   387â†’            speed_factor = 1.0\n   388â†’    \n   389â†’    logger.info(f\"--- Starting Full Automation for Video Job ID: {job_id} ---\")\n   390â†’    logger.info(f\"Video speed adjustment factor: {speed_factor}x (will be applied during assembly)\")\n   391â†’    env = config.get('env', 'PROD').upper()\n   392â†’    gsheets_config = config.get('google_sheets', {})\n   393â†’    spreadsheet_id = gsheets_config.get(f'spreadsheet_id_{env.lower()}')\n   394â†’    job_status_tab = gsheets_config.get('job_status_tab_name')\n   395â†’    job_status_cols = gsheets_config.get('job_status_tab_columns', {})\n   396â†’\n   397â†’    # Local paths\n   398â†’    local_job_dir = Path(\"local_video_jobs\").resolve() / job_id\n   399â†’    plan_path = local_job_dir / \"04_aligned_overlay_scene_plan.json\"\n   400â†’    local_assets_dir = local_job_dir / \"User_Uploaded_Assets\"\n   401â†’\n   402â†’    if not plan_path.exists():\n   403â†’        logger.error(f\"Aligned scene plan not found at: {plan_path}\")\n   404â†’        logger.error(\"Please ensure the job creation monitor has been run successfully for this job first.\")\n   405â†’        sys.exit(1)\n   406â†’\n   407â†’    # --- Google Services ---\n   408â†’    drive_service, sheets_service = get_google_services()\n   409â†’    if not drive_service or not sheets_service:\n   410â†’        logger.error(\"Failed to initialize Google services.\")\n   411â†’        sys.exit(1)\n   412â†’\n   413â†’    # --- Fetch Job Info from GSheet ---\n   414â†’    logger.info(\"Fetching job details from Google Sheet...\")\n   415â†’    job_id_col_name = job_status_cols.get('job_id')\n   416â†’    headers_result = sheets_service.spreadsheets().values().get(spreadsheetId=spreadsheet_id, range=f\"'{job_status_tab}'!A1:Z1\").execute()\n   417â†’    headers = headers_result.get('values', [[]])[0]\n   418â†’    job_id_col_index = headers.index(job_id_col_name)\n   419â†’    job_id_col_letter = chr(ord('A') + job_id_col_index)\n   420â†’    result = sheets_service.spreadsheets().values().get(spreadsheetId=spreadsheet_id, range=f\"'{job_status_tab}'!{job_id_col_letter}:{job_id_col_letter}\").execute()\n   421â†’    job_ids_in_col = result.get('values', [])\n   422â†’    row_number_to_update = -1\n   423â†’    for i, row_data in enumerate(job_ids_in_col):\n   424â†’        if row_data and row_data[0] == job_id:\n   425â†’            row_number_to_update = i + 1\n   426â†’            break\n   427â†’    if row_number_to_update == -1:\n   428â†’        logger.error(f\"Could not find Job ID '{job_id}' in the '{job_status_tab}' tab.\")\n   429â†’        sys.exit(1)\n   430â†’\n   431â†’    job_row_data = sheets_service.spreadsheets().values().get(spreadsheetId=spreadsheet_id, range=f\"'{job_status_tab}'!A{row_number_to_update}:Z{row_number_to_update}\").execute().get('values', [[]])[0]\n   432â†’    job_info = dict(zip(headers, job_row_data))\n   433â†’\n   434â†’    # Extract article title for notifications\n   435â†’    article_title = job_info.get(job_status_cols.get('source_article_title'), 'Unknown Title')\n   436â†’\n   437â†’    # Check if final video link already exists\n   438â†’    existing_final_video_link = job_info.get(job_status_cols.get('final_video_gdrive_link'))\n   439â†’    if existing_final_video_link and existing_final_video_link.strip():\n   440â†’        logger.info(f\"Final video link already exists: {existing_final_video_link}\")\n   441â†’        logger.info(\"Job appears to be already complete. If you want to regenerate, clear the final video link in the spreadsheet first.\")\n   442â†’        # Still proceed with the process in case the user wants to regenerate\n   443â†’        logger.info(\"Proceeding anyway to allow for regeneration...\")\n   444â†’\n   445â†’    asset_folder_url = job_info.get(job_status_cols.get('gdrive_user_asset_upload_subfolder_url'))\n   446â†’    outputs_folder_url = job_info.get(job_status_cols.get('gdrive_pipeline_outputs_subfolder_url'))\n   447â†’    if not asset_folder_url or not outputs_folder_url:\n   448â†’        logger.error(\"Asset upload folder URL or Pipeline outputs folder URL not found in spreadsheet.\")\n   449â†’        sys.exit(1)\n   450â†’\n   451â†’    asset_folder_id = asset_folder_url.split('/')[-1]\n   452â†’    outputs_folder_id = outputs_folder_url.split('/')[-1]\n   453â†’\n   454â†’    # --- Step 1: Download Assets ---\n   455â†’    download_gdrive_folder_contents(drive_service, asset_folder_id, local_assets_dir)\n   456â†’\n   457â†’    # Save the base orchestration summary to the merged plan file\n   458â†’    merged_plan_path = local_job_dir / \"04_merged_aligned_overlay_scene_plan.json\"\n   459â†’    if merged_plan_path.exists():\n   460â†’        logger.info(f\"Merged scene plan already exists at: {merged_plan_path}, skipping asset matching and LLM.\")\n   461â†’        with open(merged_plan_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:\n   462â†’            base_orchestration_summary = json.load(f)\n   463â†’        merged_scene_plan = base_orchestration_summary[\"overlay_scenes_with_assets\"]\n   464â†’        bg_music_path = base_orchestration_summary.get(\"background_music_path\")\n   465â†’        music_variations = []\n   466â†’        if bg_music_path:\n   467â†’            music_name = Path(bg_music_path).stem\n   468â†’            music_variations.append({\n   469â†’                \"music_path\": bg_music_path,\n   470â†’                \"variation_name\": music_name,\n   471â†’                \"filename\": f\"{job_id}_final_video_with_overlays.mp4\"\n   472â†’            })\n   473â†’        else:\n   474â†’            music_variations.append({\n   475â†’                \"music_path\": None,\n   476â†’                \"variation_name\": \"no_music\",\n   477â†’                \"filename\": f\"{job_id}_final_video_with_overlays.mp4\"\n   478â†’            })\n   479â†’        # Build orchestration_summaries for downstream use\n   480â†’        orchestration_summaries = []\n   481â†’        for variation in music_variations:\n   482â†’            orchestration_summary = {\n   483â†’                \"overlay_project_id\": job_id,\n   484â†’                \"overlay_scene_plan_file_used\": str(merged_plan_path),\n   485â†’                \"overlay_scenes_with_assets\": merged_scene_plan,\n   486â†’                \"background_music_path\": variation[\"music_path\"]\n   487â†’            }\n   488â†’            orchestration_summaries.append((orchestration_summary, variation))\n   489â†’    else:\n   490â†’        # --- Step 2: LLM Matching ---\n   491â†’        load_dotenv()\n   492â†’        anthropic_api_key = ConfigManager.get_env_var(\"ANTHROPIC_API_KEY\")\n   493â†’        if not anthropic_api_key:\n   494â†’            logger.error(\"ANTHROPIC_API_KEY not found in environment variables.\")\n   495â†’            sys.exit(1)\n   496â†’\n   497â†’        llm_config = config.get('llm_script_generation', {})\n   498â†’        claude_model = llm_config.get('model_name', 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514')\n   499â†’        claude_client = ClaudeClient(api_key=anthropic_api_key, model=claude_model)\n   500â†’\n   501â†’        # Extract job metadata to help with asset matching\n   502â†’        job_metadata = extract_job_metadata_for_matching(job_info, job_status_cols)\n   503â†’        logger.info(f\"Job metadata for asset matching: {job_metadata}\")\n   504â†’\n   505â†’        merged_result = match_local_assets_with_llm(plan_path, local_assets_dir, claude_client, job_id, job_metadata)\n   506â†’        merged_scene_plan = merged_result['scene_plan']\n   507â†’        bg_music_path = merged_result['bg_music_path']\n   508â†’        bg_music_files = merged_result.get('bg_music_files', [])\n   509â†’\n   510â†’        # Determine how many music variations to create\n   511â†’        music_variations = []\n   512â†’        if bg_music_files and len(bg_music_files) > 1:\n   513â†’            logger.info(f\"Multiple music files detected ({len(bg_music_files)}). Will create video variations for each.\")\n   514â†’            for i, music_file in enumerate(bg_music_files):\n   515â†’                music_name = Path(music_file).stem  # Get filename without extension\n   516â†’                variation_name = f\"music_{i+1:02d}_{music_name}\"\n   517â†’                music_variations.append({\n   518â†’                    \"music_path\": music_file,\n   519â†’                    \"variation_name\": variation_name,\n   520â†’                    \"filename\": f\"{job_id}_final_video_with_overlays_{variation_name}.mp4\"\n   521â†’                })\n   522â†’        else:\n   523â†’            # duration\n        }\n        \n        success = apply_ken_burns_ffmpeg(\n            str(asset.path),\n            str(output_path),\n            duration,\n            ken_burns_config,\n            f\"Test content for {effect_type}\"\n        )\n        \n        assert success, f\"Ken Burns effect {effect_type} failed\"\n        \n        validation = self.validate_video_output(output_path, duration)\n        assert validation[\"valid\"], f\"Validation failed: {validation.get('errors', [])}\"\n        \n        # Special check for short durations\n        if duration <= 1.5:\n            assert validation[\"actual_duration\"] >= 0.9, \"Short duration videos should still be close to target\"\n    \n    def test_ken_burns_with_various_aspect_ratios(self, test_assets, temp_output_dir):\n        \"\"\"Test Ken Burns with different image aspect ratios.\"\"\"\n        duration = 3.0\n        \n        for asset in test_assets[:3]:  # Test first 3 assets\n            output_path = temp_output_dir / f\"ken_burns_{asset.name}_aspect_test.mp4\"\n            \n            # Use auto-selection based on aspect ratio\n            ken_burns_config = {\n                \"type\": \"auto\",\n                \"intensity\": \"normal\"\n            }\n            \n            success = apply_ken_burns_ffmpeg(\n                str(asset.path),\n                str(output_path),\n failed for {asset} (aspect: {asset.aspect_ratio:.2f})\"\n            \n            validation = self.validate_video_output(output_path, duration)\n            assert validation[\"valid\"], blur_intensity, zoom_factor):\n        \"\"\"Test background blur with different parameters.\"\"\"\n        asset = test_assets[0]\n        duration = 2.0\n        \n        output_path = duration,\n                TIKTOK_DIMS,\n                fps=30,\n                force_vertical=\"background_blur\",\n                bg_blur_intensity=blur_intensity,\n                bg_zoom_factor=zoom_factor\n            )\n            \n            assert clip is not None, \"Background blur processing failed\"\n            clip.write_videofile(str(output_path), verbose=False, logger=None)\n            clip.close()\n            \n            validation = self.validate_video_output(output_path, duration)\n            assert validation[\"valid\"], f\"Validation failed: {validation.get('errors', [])}\"\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            pytest.fail(f\"Background blur test failed: {e}\")\n    \n    def test_background_blur_aspect_ratios(self, test_assets, temp_output_dir):\n        \"\"\"Test background blur with various image aspect ratios.\"\"\"\n        duration = 2.0\n        \n        for asset in test_assets:\n            output_path composition.\"\"\"\n        asset = test_assets[0]\n        duration = 3.0\n        \n        # Step 1: Create background blur composition\n        bg_blur_path = temp_output_dir / current limitations: {e}\")\n\n\nclass TestEdgeCases(TestFXValidation):\n    \"\"\"Test edge cases and error conditions.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_very_short_durations(self, test_assets, lenient with short durations\n                assert validation[\"actual_duration\"] > 0.3, f\"Duration too short: {validation['actual_duration']}\"\n            else:\n                # Short durations might fail - this is expected behavior\n                print(f\"Ken Burns failed for {duration}s duration (expected for very short segments)\")\n    \n    def test_missing_assets(self, Include short durations\nMIN_KENBURNS_DURATION = 2.0  # Minimum for smooth Ken Burns\n\n\nclass FXValidationError(Exception):\n    \"\"\"Custom exception for FX validation failures.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n\nclass FXTestFramework:\n    \"\"\"Test framework for validating FX pipeline operations.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, temp_dir: pathlib.Path = None):\n        self.temp_dir = temp_dir or pathlib.Path(tempfile.mkdtemp(prefix=\"fx_test_\"))\n        self.temp_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        self.test_results = []\n        \n    def cleanup(self):\n        \"\"\"Clean up temporary files.\"\"\"\n        if self.temp_dir.exists():\n            shutil.rmtree(self.temp_dir)\n    \n    def validate_output_video(self, video_path: pathlib.Path, expected_duration: float, \n                            expected_dims: Tuple[int, int] = TIKTOK_DIMS) -> Dict:\n        \"\"\"\n        Validate video output meets requirements.\n        \n        Args:\n            video_path: Path to output video\n            expected_duration: Expected duration in seconds\n            expected_dims: Expected dimensions (width, height)\n            \n        Returns:\n            Dictionary with validation results\n        \"\"\"\n        if not video_path.exists():\n            raise FXValidationError(f\"Output video not found: {video_path}\")\n        \n        try:\n            with VideoFileClip(str(video_path)) as clip:\n                actual_duration = clip.duration\n                actual_dims = clip.size\n                file_size_mb = video_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)\n                \n                # Validation checks\n                duration_diff = abs(actual_duration - expected_duration)\n                duration_tolerance = 0.1  # 100ms tolerance\n                \n                validation_result = {\n                    \"file_path\": str(video_path),\n                    \"file_size_mb\": round(file_size_mb, 2),\n                    \"expected_duration\": expected_duration,\n                    \"actual_duration\": actual_duration,\n                    \"duration_diff\": duration_diff,\n                    \"duration_valid\": duration_diff <= duration_tolerance,\n                    \"expected_dims\": expected_dims,\n                    \"actual_dims\": actual_dims,\n                    \"dims_valid\": actual_dims == expected_dims,\n                    \"has_video\": clip.duration > 0,\n                    \"has_audio\": clip.audio is not None,\n                    \"fps\": clip.fps\n                }\n                \n                # Overall validation\n                validation_result[\"valid\"] = (\n                    validation_result[\"duration_valid\"] and \n                    validation_result[\"dims_valid\"] and \n                    validation_result[\"has_video\"]\n                )\n                \n                return validation_result\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            raise FXValidationError(f\"Failed to validate video {video_path}: {e}\")\n    \n    def create_test_scene_config(self, scene_id: str, asset_path: str, \n                               duration: float, fx_config: Dict) -> Dict:\n        \"\"\"Create test scene configuration.\"\"\"\n        return {\n            \"scene_id\": scene_id,\n            \"text_for_scene\": f\"Test scene {scene_id}\",\n            \"estimated_duration\": duration,\n            \"start_time\": 0.0,\n            \"end_time\": duration,\n            \"visual_type\": \"STOCK_IMAGE\" if asset_path.endswith(('.jpg', '.png', '.jpeg')) else \"STOCK_VIDEO\",\n            \"visual_keywords\": [\"test\", \"validation\"],\n            \"asset_path\": asset_path,\n            **fx_config\n        }\n    \n    def get_test_assets(self) -> Dict[str, List[pathlib.Path]]:\n        \"\"\"Discover test assets from various locations.\"\"\"\n        assets = {\"images\": [], \"videos\": []}\n        \n        # Backend test assets\n        backend_img_dir = pathlib.Path(__file__).parent.parent / \"assets\" / \"img\"\n        if backend_img_dir.exists():\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(backend_img_dir.glob(\"*.jpg\")))\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(backend_img_dir.glob(\"*.png\")))\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(backend_img_dir.glob(\"*.jpeg\")))\n        \n        # Jack Ma test case assets\n        jack_ma_dir = pathlib.Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent / \"local_video_jobs\" / \"20250617_read-alibaba-staffers-resignation-letter-got-jack-mas-reply\" / \"User_Uploaded_Assets\"\n        if jack_ma_dir.exists():\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(jack_ma_dir.glob(\"*.jpg\")))\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(jack_ma_dir.glob(\"*.png\")))\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(jack_ma_dir.glob(\"*.jpeg\")))\n            assets[\"images\"].extend(list(jack_ma_dir.glob(\"*.webp\")))\n            assets[\"videos\"].extend(list(jack_ma_dir.glob(\"*.mp4\")))\n            assets[\"videos\"].extend(list(jack_ma_dir.glob(\"*.mov\")))\n        \n        return assets\n    \n    def analyze_asset_properties(self, asset_path: pathlib.Path) -> Dict:\n        \"\"\"Analyze properties of an asset (image or video).\"\"\"\n        try:\n            if asset_path.suffix.lower() in ['.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.webp']:\n                # Image analysis\n                with ImageClip(str(asset_path)) as clip:\n                    width, height = clip.size\n                    aspect_ratio = width / height\n                    return {\n                        \"type\": \"image\",\n                        \"width\": width,\n                        \"height\": height,\n                        \"aspect_ratio\": aspect_ratio,\n                        \"orientation\": \"portrait\" if height > width else \"landscape\" if width > height else \"square\",\n                        \"file_size_mb\": asset_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)\n                    }\n            else:\n                # Video analysis\n                with VideoFileClip(str(asset_path)) as clip:\n                    width, height = clip.size\n                    aspect_ratio = width / height\n                    return {\n                        \"type\": \"video\",\n                        \"width\": width,\n                        \"height\": height,\n                        \"aspect_ratio\": aspect_ratio,\n                        \"orientation\": \"portrait\" if height > width else \"landscape\" if width > height else \"square\",\n                        \"duration\": clip.duration,\n                        \"fps\": clip.fps,\n                        \"file_size_mb\": asset_path.stat().st_size / (1024 * 1024)\n                    }\n        except Exception as e:\n            logger.error(f\"Failed to analyze asset {asset_path}: {e}\")\n            return {\"type\": \"unknown\", \"error\": str(e)}\n\n\nclass TestFXPipelineValidation:\n    \"\"\"Test suite for FX pipeline validation.\"\"\"\n    \n    @pytest.fixture\n    def fx_framework(self):\n        \"\"\"

Log the test configuration for manual verification\n            fx_framework.test_results.append({\n                \"test_type\": \"duration_constraint\",\n                \"duration\": duration,\n                \"ken_burns_suitable\": ken_burns_suitable,\n                \"scene_config\": scene_config\n            })\n    \n    def test_fx_combinations(self, fx_framework):\n        \"\"\"Test various FX combinations.\"\"\"\n        assets = fx_framework.get_test_assets()\n        if not assets[\"images\"]:\n            pytest.skip(\"No test images available\")\n        \n        test_combinations = [\n            {\"name\": \"ken_burns_only\", \"config\": {\"ken_burns_effect\": {\"type\": \"zoom_in\"}}},\n            {\"name\": \"background_blur_only\", \"config\": {\"force_vertical\": \"background_blur\"}},\n            {\"name\": \"ken_burns_with_background_blur\", \"config\": {\n                \"ken_burns_effect\": {\"type\": \"zoom_in\"}, \n                \"force_vertical\": \"background_blur\"\n            }},\n            {\"name\": \"crop_mode\", \"config\": {\"force_vertical\": True}},\n            {\"name\": \"letterbox_mode\", \"config\": {\"force_vertical\": False}}\n        ]\n        \n        test_image = assets[\"images\"][0]\n        \n        for combo in test_combinations:\n            scene_config = fx_framework.create_test_scene_config(\n                scene_id=f\"fx_combo_{combo['name']}\",\n                asset_path=str(test_image),\n                duration=3.0,  # {"type":"assistant","message":{"id":"msg_01DBv252CdoE6skm8xcECHzE","type":"message","role":"assistant","model":"claude-sonnet-4-20250514","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_01Sbie4cecpyJHEZtwV9xKrC","name":"Write","input":{"file_path":"/Users/erniesg/code/erniesg/wanx/backend/text_to_video/fx/unified_fx_processor.py","content":"#!/usr/bin/env python3\n\"\"\"\nUnified FX Processor - Handles layered visual effects for video production\nSupports Ken Burns + Background Blur combinations with proper order of operations\n\"\"\"\n\nimport logging\nimport pathlib\nimport tempfile\nimport uuid\nfrom typing import Optional, Dict, Any, Tuple, Union\nfrom moviepy.editor import VideoFileClip, ImageClip\nfrom PIL import Image\n\n# Import existing FX modules\nfrom backend.text_to_video.fx.ken_burns_ffmpeg import apply_ken_burns_ffmpeg, process_scene_with_ken_burns\nfrom backend.video_pipeline.video_utils import (\n    process_image_to_video_clip, \n    process_video_clip,\n    create_background_blur_composition,\n    TEMP_PROCESSED_CLIPS_DIR\n)\n\nlogger = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n\nclass UnifiedFXProcessor:\n    \"\"\"\n    Processes visual effects in proper order:\n    1. Background preparation (blur, crop, letterbox)\n    2. Motion effects (Ken Burns, pan, zoom)\n    3. Output validation (dimensions, duration, quality)\n    \"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, target_dims: Tuple[int, int] = (1080, 1920), target_fps: int = 30):\n        self.target_dims = target_dims\n        self.target_fps = target_fps\n        self.temp_dir = TEMP_PROCESSED_CLIPS_DIR\n        self.temp_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        \n    def process_scene(\n        self,\n        asset_path: str,\n        scene_config: Dict[str, Any],\n        duration: float,\n        output_dir: pathlib.Path\n    ) -> Optional[VideoFileClip]:\n        \"\"\"\n        Main entry point for processing a scene with unified effects.\n        \n        Args:\n            asset_path: Path to image or video asset\n            scene_config: Scene configuration including fx settings\n            duration: Target duration in seconds\n            output_dir: Directory for intermediate outputs\n            \n        Returns:\n            VideoFileClip with applied effects or None if failed\n        \"\"\"\n        scene_id = scene_config.get(\"scene_id\", \"unknown\")\n        visual_type = scene_config.get(\"visual_type\", \"STOCK_IMAGE\")\n        force_vertical = scene_config.get(\"force_vertical\", False)\n        \n        logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Processing {scene_id}: {visual_type}, force_vertical={force_vertical}, duration={duration:.2f}s\")\n        \n        try:\n            # Validate input\n            if not pathlib.Path(asset_path).exists():\n                logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Asset not found: {asset_path}\")\n                return None\n                \n            # Check for minimum duration constraints\n            if duration < 0.5:\n                logger.warning(f\"[UnifiedFX] Very short duration ({duration:.2f}s), effects may not be smooth\")\n                \n            # Determine processing workflow\n            ken_burns_config = process_scene_with_ken_burns(scene_config, self.target_dims)\n            needs_background_blur = force_vertical == \"background_blur\"\n            \n            if needs_background_blur and ken_burns_config:\n                # Combined workflow: Background blur + Ken Burns\n                return self._process_combined_effects(\n                    asset_path, scene_config, duration, output_dir, ken_burns_config\n                )\n            elif ken_burns_config:\n                # Ken Burns only (existing workflow)\n                return self._process_ken_burns_only(\n                    asset_path, scene_config, duration, output_dir, ken_burns_config\n                )\n            elif needs_background_blur:\n                # Background blur only\n                return self._process_background_blur_only(\n                    asset_path, scene_config, duration, visual_type\n                )\n            else:\n                # Standard processing (no special effects)\n                return self._process_standard(\n                    asset_path, scene_config, duration, visual_type, force_vertical\n                )\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Error processing {scene_id}: {e}\", exc_info=True)\n            return None\n            \n    def _process_combined_effects(\n        self,\n        asset_path: str,\n        scene_config: Dict[str, Any],\n        duration: float,\n        output_dir: pathlib.Path,\n        ken_burns_config: Dict[str, Any]\n    ) -> Optional[VideoFileClip]:\n        \"\"\"\n        Process combined background blur + Ken Burns effects.\n        Workflow: Original image â†’ Background blur composition â†’ Ken Burns motion\n        \"\"\"\n        scene_id = scene_config.get(\"scene_id\", \"unknown\")\n        logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Applying combined effects (blur + Ken Burns) to {scene_id}\")\n        \n        try:\n            # Step 1: Create background blur composition using MoviePy\n            logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Step 1: Creating background blur composition\")\n            img_clip = ImageClip(asset_path)\n            blur_composition = create_background_blur_composition(\n                img_clip, self.target_dims, blur_intensity=25, bg_zoom_factor=2.25\n            )\n            blur_composition = blur_composition.set_duration(duration).set_fps(self.target_fps)\n            \n            # Step 2: Save blur composition as intermediate video\n            temp_blur_path = self.temp_dir / f\"blur_composition_{scene_id}_{uuid.uuid4().hex[:8]}.mp4\"\n            logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Saving blur composition to: {temp_blur_path}\")\n            blur_composition.write_videofile(\n                str(temp_blur_path),\n                fps=self.target_fps,\n                codec='libx264',\n                audio=False,\n                verbose=False,\n                logger=None\n            )\n            \n            # Clean up intermediate clip\n            if hasattr(img_clip, 'close'):\n                img_clip.close()\n            if hasattr(blur_composition, 'close'):\n                blur_composition.close()\n                \n            # Step 3: Apply Ken Burns to the blur composition\n            logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Step 2: Applying Ken Burns to blur composition\")\n            ken_burns_output_path = output_dir / f\"ken_burns_blur_{scene_id}.mp4\"\n            text_content = scene_config.get(\"text_for_scene\", \"\")\n            \n            ken_burns_success = apply_ken_burns_ffmpeg(\n                str(temp_blur_path),  # Use blur composition as input\n                str(ken_burns_output_path),\n                duration,\n                ken_burns_config,\n                text_content\n            )\n            \n            # Clean up intermediate blur file\n            if temp_blur_path.exists():\n                temp_blur_path.unlink()\n                \n            if ken_burns_success and ken_burns_output_path.exists():\n                logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Combined effects applied successfully: {ken_burns_output_path}\")\n                final_clip = VideoFileClip(str(ken_burns_output_path))\n                \n                # Validate output\n                if self._validate_output(final_clip, duration, scene_id):\n                    return final_clip\n                else:\n                    if hasattr(final_clip, 'close'):\n                        final_clip.close()\n                    return None\n            else:\n                logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Ken Burns failed on blur composition, falling back to blur only\")\n                return self._process_background_blur_only(asset_path, scene_config, duration, \"STOCK_IMAGE\")\n                \n        except

Dict[str, Any],\n        duration: float,\n        visual_type: str\n    ) -> Optional[VideoFileClip]:\n        \"\"\"Process background blur only.\"\"\"\n        scene_id = scene_config.get(\"scene_id\", \"unknown\")\n        logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Applying background blur only to {scene_id}\")\n        \n        if visual_type == \"STOCK_IMAGE\":\n            clip = process_image_to_video_clip(\n                asset_path, duration, self.target_dims, \n                fps=self.target_fps, force_vertical=\"background_blur\"\n            )\n        else:\n            clip = process_video_clip(\n                asset_path, duration, self.target_dims, \n                target_fps=self.target_fps, force_vertical=\"background_blur\"\n            )\n            \n        if clip and self._validate_output(clip, duration, scene_id):\n            return clip\n        else:\n            if clip and hasattr(clip, 'close'):\n                clip.close()\n            return None\n            \n    def _process_standard(\n        self,\n        asset_path: str,\n        scene_config: Dict[str, Any],\n        duration: float,\n        visual_type: str,\n        force_vertical: Union[bool, str]\n    ) -> Optional[VideoFileClip]:\n        \"\"\"Process with standard scaling/cropping (no special effects).\"\"\"\n        scene_id = scene_config.get(\"scene_id\", \"unknown\")\n        logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Applying standard processing to {scene_id}\")\n        \n        if visual_type == \"STOCK_IMAGE\":\n            clip = process_image_to_video_clip(\n                asset_path, duration, self.target_dims, \n                fps=self.target_fps, force_vertical=force_vertical\n            )\n        else:\n            start_timing = scene_config.get(\"start_timing\")\n            clip = process_video_clip(\n                asset_path, duration, self.target_dims, \n                target_fps=self.target_fps, force_vertical=force_vertical, \n                start_timing=start_timing\n            )\n            \n        if clip and self._validate_output(clip, duration, scene_id):\n            return clip\n        else:\n            if clip and hasattr(clip, 'close'):\n                clip.close()\n            return None\n            \n    def _validate_output(\n        self, \n        clip: VideoFileClip, \n        expected_duration: float, \n        scene_id: str\n    ) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Validate output clip meets requirements.\"\"\"\n        try:\n            if not clip:\n                logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Validation failed for {scene_id}: clip is None\")\n                return False\n                \n            # Check dimensions\n            clip_dims = (clip.w, clip.h)\n            if clip_dims != self.target_dims:\n                logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Validation failed for {scene_id}: dimensions {clip_dims} != target {self.target_dims}\")\n                return False\n                \n            # Check duration (allow 10% tolerance)\n            duration_diff = abs(clip.duration - expected_duration)\n            duration_tolerance = max(0.1, expected_duration * 0.1)\n            if duration_diff > duration_tolerance:\n                logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Validation failed for {scene_id}: duration {clip.duration:.2f}s != expected {expected_duration:.2f}s (diff: {duration_diff:.2f}s)\")\n                return False\n                \n            # Check FPS\n            clip_fps = getattr(clip, 'fps', None)\n            if clip_fps and abs(clip_fps - self.target_fps) > 1:\n                logger.warning(f\"[UnifiedFX] FPS mismatch for {scene_id}: {clip_fps} != {self.target_fps}\")\n                \n            logger.info(f\"[UnifiedFX] Validation passed for {scene_id}: {clip_dims}, {clip.duration:.2f}s, {clip_fps}fps\")\n            return True\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            logger.error(f\"[UnifiedFX] Validation error for {scene_id}: {e}\")\n            return False\n            \n    def cleanup_temp_files(self, scene_id: str):\n        \"\"\"Clean up temporary files for a specific scene.\"\"\"\n        try:\n            for temp_file in self.temp_dir.glob(f\"*{scene_id}*\"):\n                temp_file.unlink()\n                logger.debug(f\"[UnifiedFX] Cleaned up temp file: {temp_file}\")\n        except Exception as e:\n            logger.warning(f\"[UnifiedFX] Error cleaning temp files for {scene_id}:
